She is in pain and struggles and cries out in her labor, So we were before You, O L ord . We gave birth, as it seems, only to wind. We could not accomplish salvation for the earth, You who lie in the dust, awake and shout for joy! For your dew is a dew of [celestial] light [heavenly, supernatural], And the earth will give birth to the spirits of the dead. And shut your doors behind you; Hide for a little while To punish the inhabitants of the earth for their wickedness [their sin, their injustice, their wrongdoing]; The earth will reveal the [innocent] blood shed upon her And will no longer cover her slain.

Open the gates, that the righteous nation may enter, The one that remains faithful and trustworthy. Nor were inhabitants of the world born. Their dead bodies will rise. Until the [L ord ’ s ] wrath is past.
You will keep in perfect and constant peace the one whose mind is steadfast [that is, committed and focused on You—in both inclination and character],
Trust [confidently] in the L ord forever [He is your fortress, your shield, your banner],
For He has thrown down the [arrogant] ones who dwell on high, the lofty and inaccessible city;
The foot will trample it,
The way of the righteous [those in right-standing with God—living in moral and spiritual integrity] is smooth and level;
Indeed, in the path of Your judgments, O L ord ,
In the night my soul longs for You [O L ord ],
Though the wicked is shown compassion and favor,
Though Your hand is lifted up [to strike], O L ord , the wicked do not see it.
L ord , You will establish peace for us,
O L ord our God, other masters besides You have ruled over us;
The [wicked] dead will not live [again], the spirits of the dead will not rise and return;
You have increased the nation, O L ord ;
O L ord , they sought You in distress;
As a woman with child approaches the time to give birth,
We have been with child, we have twisted and struggled in labor;
Your dead will live;
Come, my people, enter your chambers
Listen carefully, the L ord is about to come out of His [heavenly] place

27.verse_text: In that day the Lord will punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent With His fierce and great and mighty sword [rescuing Israel from her enemy], Even Leviathan the twisted serpent; And He will kill the dragon who lives in the sea. I water it every moment. So that no one will harm it, I guard it night and day. Should anyone give Me briars and thorns in battle, I would step on them, I would set them all on fire. Let him make peace with Me, Let him make peace with Me.” Israel will blossom and sprout, And they will fill the surface of the world with fruit. Or like the slaughter of His slain, have they been slain? He has expelled them with His fierce wind on the day of the east wind. When Israel makes all the stones of the [pagan] altars like crushed chalk stones; When the Asherim and the incense altars will not stand. A settlement deserted and abandoned like the desert; There the calf will graze, For they are not a people of understanding, Therefore He who made them will not have compassion on them, And He who created them will not be gracious to them.

In that day [it will be said of the redeemed nation of Israel], “A vineyard of wine, sing in praise of it! And this will be the full price [that God requires] for taking away his sin: And there it will lie down and feed on its branches. The women come and make a fire with them.
I, the L ord , am its Keeper;
Or let him (Israel) cling to My strength and rely on My protection [My stronghold],
In the generations to come Jacob will take root;
Like the striking by Him who has struck them, has He struck them?
You contended with them by exile, by driving them away [from Canaan];
Therefore through this the wickedness [the sin, the injustice, the wrongdoing] of Jacob (Israel) will be atoned for and forgiven;
For the fortified city is isolated,
When its branches are dry, they are broken off;
In that day the L ord will thresh [out His grain] from the flowing stream of the River [Euphrates] to the Brook of Egypt, and you will be gathered up one by one, O sons of Israel.

It will come to pass in that day that a great trumpet will be blown, and those who were lost and perishing in the land of Assyria and who were scattered in the land of Egypt will come and worship the L ord on the holy mountain at Jerusalem.

28.verse_text: Woe (judgment is coming) to [Samaria] the splendid crown of the drunkards of Ephraim, And to the fading flower of its glorious beauty, Which is at the head of the rich valley Of those who are overcome with wine! Like a tempest of hail, a disastrous storm, Like a tempest of mighty overflowing waters, He has cast it down to the earth with His hand. Which is at the head of the rich valley, Will be like the early fig before the summer, Which one sees, And as soon as it is in his hand He [greedily] swallows it [and so will the Assyrians rapidly devour Samaria, Israel’s capital]. And a glorious diadem to the [converted] remnant of His people, A strength to those who drive back the battle at the gate. The priest and the prophet reel with strong drink; They are confused by wine, they stagger from strong drink; They reel while seeing visions, They stagger when pronouncing judgment. And to whom would He explain the message? Those just weaned from milk? Those just taken from the breast? ‘Precept upon precept, precept upon precept, Rule upon rule, rule upon rule, Here a little, there a little.’ ” By [men with] stammering lips and a foreign tongue, And, “This is the resting place,” yet they would not listen. “Precept upon precept, precept upon precept, Rule upon rule, rule upon rule, Here a little, there a little.” That they may go and stumble backward, and be broken, ensnared, and taken captive. Who rule this people who are in Jerusalem! And with Sheol (the place of the dead) we have made an agreement, When the overwhelming scourge passes by, it will not reach us, For we have made lies our refuge and we have concealed ourselves in deception.” “Listen carefully, I am laying in Zion a Stone, a tested Stone, A precious Cornerstone for the [secure] foundation, firmly placed. And righteousness the mason’s level; Then hail will sweep away the refuge of lies And waters will flood over the secret [hiding] place. And your agreement with Sheol (the place of the dead) will not stand; When the overwhelming scourge passes through, Then you will become its trampling ground. For morning after morning it will pass through, by day and by night, And it will be sheer terror to understand what it means.” And the blanket is too narrow to wrap around oneself [and likewise all their preparations are inadequate]. He will be stirred up as in the Valley of Gibeon, To do His work, His unusual and incredible work, And to accomplish His work, His extraordinary work. Or the bands which bind you will be made stronger; For I have heard from the Lord G od of hosts [a decree] Of decisive destruction on all the earth. Listen carefully and hear my words. Does he continually dig furrows and harrow his ground [after it is prepared]? Does he not sow [the seed of] dill and scatter cumin, And plant wheat in rows, Nor is a cartwheel rolled over cumin; But dill is beaten out with a staff, and cumin with a rod. Indeed, the farmer does not continue to thresh it forever. Because the wheel of his cart and his horses eventually damage it, He does not thresh it longer. Who has made His counsel wonderful and His wisdom great.
Listen carefully, the Lord has a strong and mighty agent [the Assyrian];
The splendid crown of the drunkards of Ephraim is trampled by [the foreigners’] feet.
And the fading flower of its glorious beauty,
In that day the L ord of hosts will become a magnificent crown
A spirit of justice for him who sits in judgment [administering the law],
But even these reel with wine and stagger from strong drink:
For all the tables are full of filthy vomit, so that there is no place [that is clean.]
They say “To whom would He teach knowledge?
For He says ,
Indeed, the L ord will teach this people [in a more humiliating way]
He who said to them, “This is the place of quiet, give rest to the weary,”
Therefore the word of the L ord to them will be [merely monotonous repetitions]:
Therefore, hear the word of the L ord , you arrogant men
Because you have said, “We have made a covenant with death,

Therefore the Lord G od says this, He who believes [who trusts in, relies on, and adheres to that Stone] will not be disturbed or give way [in sudden panic]. And barley in its [intended] place and rye within its border?
I will make justice the measuring line
Your covenant with death will be annulled,
As often as it passes through, it will seize you;
For the bed is too short to stretch out on,
For the L ord will rise up as at Mount Perazim,
Now do not carry on as scoffers,
Listen and hear my voice;
Does the farmer plow all day to plant seed?
When he has leveled its surface,
For his God instructs [him correctly] and teaches him properly.
For dill is not threshed with a sharp threshing sledge,
Bread grain is crushed fine,
This also comes from the L ord of hosts,

29.verse_text: Woe (judgment is coming) to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David [once] camped! Add yet another year; let the feasts run their course [but only one year more]. Yet she will be like an Ariel [an altar hearth] to Me. And the multitude of the tyrants like the chaff which blows away; But when he awakens, his hunger is not satisfied; And she will be a city of mourning and lamenting (crying out in grief) And I will hem you in with siege works, And I will raise fortifications against you. You will speak from the earth, And from the dust where you lie face down Your muffled words will come . Your voice will also be like that of a spirit from the earth [like one produced by a medium], And your speech will whisper and squeak from the dust. And it will happen in an instant, suddenly [that your enemy is destroyed]. With whirlwind and tempest and the flame of a consuming fire. Even all who fight against her and her stronghold, and who distress her, Will be like a dream, a vision of the night. That he is eating, Or as when a thirsty man dreams That he is drinking, But when he awakens, in fact, he is faint And his thirst is not quenched. So will the multitude of all the nations be Who fight against Mount Zion. Blind yourselves and be blinded [at its fulfillment by your spiritual incompetence]. They are drunk, but not from wine; They stagger, but not from strong drink. He has closed your eyes, [you who are] the prophets; And He has covered your heads, [you who are] the seers. “Because this nation approaches [Me only] with their words And honors Me [only] with their lip service, But they remove their hearts far from Me, And their reverence for Me is a tradition that is learned by rote [without any regard for its meaning], And the wisdom of their wise men will perish, And the understanding of their discerning men will be hidden.” Whose deeds are done in a dark place, And who say, “Who sees us?” or “Who knows us?” Shall the potter be considered equal with the clay, That the thing that is made would say to its maker, “He did not make me”; Or the thing that is formed say to him who formed it, “He has no understanding”? Until Lebanon will be turned into a fertile field, And the fertile field regarded as a forest? And out of their gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see [the words of the book]. And the needy of mankind will rejoice and celebrate in the Holy One of Israel. Indeed all who are intent on doing evil will be cut off— And lay a trap for him who upholds justice at the [city] gate, And defraud the one in the right with meaningless arguments. “Jacob will not be ashamed, nor will his face turn pale [with disappointment because of his children’s degenerate behavior]; They will sanctify My Name; They will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob And will stand in awe and reverent fear of the God of Israel. And those who criticize and murmur discontentedly will accept instruction.
Then I will harass Ariel,
I will camp against you and encircle you,
Then you [Jerusalem] will be brought low,
But the multitude of your enemies [that assault you] will become like fine dust,
You will be punished by the L ord of hosts with thunder and earthquake and great noise,
And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel (Jerusalem),
It will be as when a hungry man dreams
Stop and take some time and wonder [at this prophecy],
For the L ord has poured over you a spirit of deep sleep.

The entire vision [of all these things] will be to you like the words of a scroll that is sealed, which they give to one who can read, saying, “Read this, please,” he shall say, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
Then the book will be given to the one who cannot read, saying, “Read this, please.” And he will say, “I cannot read.”
Then the Lord said,
Therefore, listen carefully, I will again do marvelous and amazing things with this people, wonderful and astonishing things;
Woe (judgment is coming) to those who [try to] deeply hide their plans from the L ord ,
You turn things upside down [with your perversity]!
Is it not yet a very little while
On that day the deaf will hear the words of a book,
The afflicted also will increase their joy in the L ord ,
For the tyrant will come to an end and the scorner will be finished,
Those who cause a person to be condemned with a [false] word,
Therefore, the L ord , who redeemed Abraham [from paganism] says this, concerning the house of Jacob (Israel):
For when he sees his children, the work of My hands, in his midst,
Those who err in mind will know the truth,

30.verse_text: “Woe (judgment is coming) to the rebellious children,” declares the L ord , “Who carry out a plan, but not Mine, And make an alliance [by pouring out a libation], but not of My Spirit, In order to add sin to sin; To take refuge in the stronghold of Pharaoh And to take shelter in the shadow of Egypt! And the refuge in the shadow of Egypt, your humiliation and disgrace. And his ambassadors arrive at Hanes [in Egypt]. Who are not a help or benefit, but a shame and also a disgrace.” Through a land of trouble and anguish, They carry their riches on the shoulders of young donkeys And their treasures on the humps of camels, To a people (Egyptians) who cannot benefit them. Therefore, I have called her “Rahab Who Has Been Exterminated.” And inscribe it on a scroll, So that it may serve in the time to come As a witness [against them] forevermore. Sons who refuse to listen to The law and instruction of the L ord ; And to the prophets, “You must not prophesy to us what is right! Speak to us pleasant things and smooth words, Prophesy [deceitful] illusions [that we will enjoy]. Stop bothering us with the Holy One of Israel.” “Because you have refused and rejected this word [of Mine] And have put your trust in oppression and guile, and have relied on them, Like a crack [in a wall] about to fall, A bulge in a high wall, Whose collapse comes suddenly in an instant, Crushed so savagely that there cannot be found among its pieces a potsherd [large enough] To take [coals of] fire from a fireplace, Or to scoop water from a cistern.” “In returning [to Me] and rest you shall be saved, In quietness and confident trust is your strength.” But you were not willing, Therefore you will flee [from your enemies]! And [you said], “We will ride on swift horses!” Therefore those who pursue you shall be swift. You will flee at the threat of five, Until you are left like a flag on the top of a mountain, And like a signal on a hill. And therefore He waits on high to have compassion on you. Blessed (happy, fortunate) are all those who long for Him [since He will never fail them]. And His tongue is like a consuming fire. Which reaches to the neck, To sift the nations back and forth in a sieve [of disaster], And to put in the jaws of the peoples the bridle which leads to ruin. And joy of heart as when one marches [in procession] with a flute, To go to the [temple on the] mountain of the L ord , to the Rock of Israel. And show the descending of His arm [striking] in [His] fierce anger, And in the flame of a devouring fire, In the crashing sound of heavy rain, cloudburst, and hailstones. When He strikes [them] with the rod. Which the L ord will lay on them, Will be to the music of Israel’s tambourines and lyres; And in battles, brandishing weapons, He will fight Assyria. Indeed, it has been prepared for the [Assyrian] king. He has made it deep and wide, A pit of fire with plenty of wood; The breath of the L ord , like a river of brimstone (blazing sulfur), kindles and fans it.

Who proceed down to Egypt Without consulting Me, From where come lioness and lion, viper and [fiery] flying serpent, For the L ord is a God of justice; Burning with His anger, and heavy with smoke; His lips are full of indignation,
Therefore the safety and protection of Pharaoh will be your shame
For his princes are at Zoan
All will be ashamed because of a people (the Egyptians) who cannot benefit them,
A [mournful, inspired] oracle ( a burden to be carried) concerning the beasts of the Negev (the South):
For Egypt’s help is worthless and good for nothing.
Now, go, write it on a tablet before them
For this is a rebellious people, lying sons,
Who say to the seers, “You must not see visions from God”;
Get out of the [true] way, turn aside from the path [of God],
Therefore, the Holy One of Israel says this,
Therefore this wickedness [this sin, this injustice, this wrongdoing] will be to you
Whose collapse is like the smashing of a potter’s jar,
For the Lord G od , the Holy One of Israel has said this,
And you said, “No! We will flee on horses!”
A thousand of you will flee at the threat of one man;
Therefore the L ord waits [expectantly] and longs to be gracious to you,
O people in Zion, inhabitant in Jerusalem, you will weep no longer. He will most certainly be gracious to you at the sound of your cry for help; when He hears it, He will answer you.
Though the Lord gives you the bread of adversity and the water of oppression, yet your Teacher will no longer hide Himself, but your eyes will [constantly] see your Teacher.
Your ears will hear a word behind you, “This is the way, walk in it,” whenever you turn to the right or to the left.
And you will defile your carved images overlaid with silver, and your cast images plated with gold. You will scatter them like a bloodstained cloth, and will say to them, “Be gone!”

Then He will give you rain for the seed with which you sow the ground, and bread [grain] from the produce of the ground, and it will be rich and plentiful. In that day your livestock will graze in large and roomy pastures.
Also the oxen and the young donkeys that work the ground will eat salted fodder, which has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.
On every lofty mountain and on every high hill there will be streams of water on the day of the great slaughter (the day of the L ord ), when the towers fall [and all His enemies are destroyed].

The light of the full moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven days [concentrated in one], in the day the L ord binds up the fracture of His people and heals the wound He has inflicted [because of their sins].
Now look, the name of the L ord comes from far away,
His breath is like an overflowing river,
You will have a song as in the night when a holy feast is kept,
And the L ord will make His majestic voice heard,
For at the voice of the L ord the Assyrians will be terrified,
And every blow of the rod of punishment,
For Topheth [in Hinnom] has long been ready;

31.verse_text: Woe (judgment is coming) to those who go down to Egypt for help, Who rely on horses And trust in chariots because they are many, And in horsemen because they are very strong, But they do not look to the Holy One of Israel, nor seek and consult the L ord ! And does not retract His words, But will arise against the house of evildoers And against the helpers of those who do evil. And their horses are flesh and not spirit; And the L ord will stretch out His hand, And he (Egypt) who helps will stumble, And he (Judah) who is helped will fall, And all of them will perish together. “As the lion or the young lion growls over his prey, And though a large group of shepherds is called out against him He will not be terrified at their voice nor cringe at their noise, So the L ord of hosts will come down to wage war on Mount Zion and on its hill.” He will protect and save it, He will pass over and rescue it. And a sword not of man will devour him. And he will flee from the sword [of God], And his young men will become forced labor. And his princes will be terrified at the [sight of the battle] standard,” Declares the L ord , whose fire is in Zion and whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
Yet He is also wise and will bring disaster,
Now the Egyptians are men and not God,
For so the L ord says to me,
Like flying birds, so will the L ord of hosts protect Jerusalem;
Return to Him from whom you have so deeply defected, O sons of Israel.
For in that day every man will reject and throw away his idols of silver and his idols of gold [in disgust], which your own hands have sinfully made for you.
Then the Assyrian will fall by a sword not of man,
“His rock [his stronghold] will pass away because of panic,

32.verse_text: Behold, a King will reign in righteousness, And princes will rule with justice. And a shelter from the storm, Like streams of water in a dry land, Like the shade of a huge rock in a parched and weary land [to those who turn to them]. And the ears of those who hear will listen attentively. And the tongue of the stammerers will hurry to speak clearly. Nor the rogue said to be generous. And his heart (mind) plans wickedness: To practice ungodliness and to speak error concerning the L ord , To keep the craving of the hungry unsatisfied And to deprive the thirsty of drink. He conceives wicked plans To ruin the poor with lies, Even when the plea of the needy one is just and right. And he stands by what is noble and magnificent. And hear my voice, You confident and unsuspecting daughters! Listen to what I am saying. You will tremble [with anxiety], you unsuspecting and complacent women; For the vintage has ended, And the harvest will not come. Tremble with fear, you complacent ones! Strip, undress and wear sackcloth on your waist [in grief], Yes, [mourn] for all the houses of joy in the joyous city. The hill [of the city] and the watchtower have become caves [for wild animals] forever, A delight for wild donkeys, a pasture for flocks, And the wilderness becomes a fertile field, And the fertile field is valued as a forest. And righteousness will live in the fertile field. And the result of righteousness will be quietness and confident trust forever. And in secure dwellings and in undisturbed resting places. And the [capital] city will fall in utter humiliation. You who allow the ox and the donkey to roam freely.
Each [one of them] will be like a hiding place from the wind
Then the eyes of those who see will not be blinded,
The heart (mind) of those who act impulsively will discern the truth,
The fool (the good-for-nothing) will no longer be called noble,
For the fool speaks nonsense,
As for the rogue, his weapons are evil;
But the noble man conceives noble and magnificent things;
Rise up, you women who are carefree,
In little more than a year
Tremble, you women who are carefree;
Beat your breasts [in mourning] for the beautiful fields, for the fruitful vine,
For the land of my people growing over with thorns and briars—
For the palace has been abandoned, the populated city deserted;
Until the Spirit is poured out upon us from on high,
Then justice will dwell in the wilderness,
And the effect of righteousness will be peace,
Then my people will live in a peaceful surrounding,
But it will hail, when the forest comes down,
Blessed (happy, fortunate) are you who cast your seed upon all waters [ when the river overflows its banks and irrigates the land],

33.verse_text: Woe (judgment is coming) to you, O destroyer, You who were not destroyed, And he who is treacherous, while others did not deal treacherously with him. As soon as you finish destroying, you will be destroyed; As soon as you stop dealing treacherously, others will deal treacherously with you. Be the arm of Your servants every morning [that is, their strength and their defense], Our salvation also in the time of trouble. At the lifting up of Yourself nations scatter. As locusts swarming so people swarm on it. He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness. A treasure of salvation, wisdom and knowledge; The fear of the L ord is your treasure. The ambassadors [seeking a treaty] of peace weep bitterly. He has no regard for [any] man. Lebanon is shamed and [its lush foliage] withers; “Now I will be exalted; now I will be lifted up. My breath is a fire that will consume you. Like thorns cut down which are burned in the fire. And you who are near, acknowledge My might.” Trembling has seized the godless. [They cry] “Who among us can live with the consuming fire? Who among us can live with everlasting burning?” Who rejects gain from fraud and from oppression, Who shakes his hand free from the taking of bribes, Who stops his ears from hearing about bloodshed And shuts his eyes to avoid looking upon evil; His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks, His bread will be given him; His water will be permanent. They will see a far-distant land. “Where is he who counts? Where is he who weighs [the tribute]? Where is he who counts the towers?” A people of unintelligible speech which no one comprehends, Of a strange and stammering tongue which no one understands. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a undisturbed settlement, A tent which will not be taken down; Not one of its stakes will ever be pulled up, Nor any of its ropes be severed. A place of broad rivers and streams, Where no oar-driven boat will go, And on which no mighty and stately ship will pass. The L ord is our Ruler, The L ord is our King; He will save us. They cannot hold the base of their mast firmly, Nor spread out the sail. Then an abundance of spoil and plunder will be divided; Even the lame will take the plunder. The people who dwell there will be forgiven their wickedness [their sin, their injustice, their wrongdoing].
O L ord , be gracious to us; we have waited [expectantly] for You.
At the sound of the tumult, the peoples flee;
Your spoil [of Israel’s foe] is gathered [by the people of Jerusalem] as the caterpillar gathers;
The L ord is exalted, for He dwells on high;
And He will be the security and stability of your times,
Now look, their brave men shout outside;

The highways are deserted, the traveler has ceased [to appear]. The enemy has broken the covenant, he has rejected the cities, Sharon is like a desert plain, And Bashan and [Mount] Carmel shake off their leaves.
The land mourns and dries out,
“Now I will arise,” says the L ord .
You have conceived dried grass, you will give birth to stubble;
The peoples will be burned to lime,
“You who are far away, hear what I have done;
The sinners in Zion are terrified;
He who walks righteously and speaks with integrity,
He will dwell on the heights,
Your eyes will see the King in His beauty;
Your mind will meditate on the terror [asking]:
You will no longer see the fierce and insolent people,
Look upon Zion, the city of our appointed feasts and observances;
But there the mighty and magnificent L ord will be for us
For the L ord is our Judge,
Your ship’s ropes (tackle) hang loose;
And no inhabitant [of Zion] will say, “I am sick”;

34.verse_text: Come near, you nations, to hear; and listen, O peoples! Let the earth and all that is in it hear, and the world and all that comes forth from it. And His wrath is against all their armies; He has given them over to slaughter. And the stench of their corpses will rise, And the mountains will flow with their blood. And the skies will be rolled up like a scroll; All their hosts [the stars and the planets] will also wither away As a leaf withers from the vine, And as a fig withers from the fig tree. Indeed, it will come down for judgment on Edom And on the people whom I have doomed for destruction. It drips with fat, with the blood of lambs and goats, With the fat of the kidneys of rams. For the L ord has a sacrifice in Bozrah (Edom’s capital city) And a great slaughter in the land of Edom. And the young bulls with the strong bulls; And their land will be soaked with blood, And their dust made greasy with fat. A year of retribution for the cause of Zion. And its dust into brimstone, And its land will become burning pitch. Its smoke will go up forever. From generation to generation it will lie in ruins; No one will ever again pass through it. The owl and the raven will dwell in it. And He will stretch over it (Edom) the measuring line of desolation And the plumb line of emptiness. Whom they may proclaim king— And all its princes will be nothing. Nettles and brambles in its fortified cities; It will be a haunt for jackals, An abode for ostriches. And find herself a place of rest. And hatch them and gather her young under her protection; Indeed, the birds of prey will be gathered there [to breed], Every one with its own kind. Not one of these [creatures] will be missing; None will lack its mate. For His mouth has commanded, And His Spirit has gathered them. They will possess it forever; From generation to generation they will dwell in it.

For the L ord is angry at all the nations, He has utterly doomed them, And the hairy goat will call to its kind; Indeed, Lilith (night demon) will settle there And His hand has divided and apportioned Edom to the wild beasts by measuring-line.
So their slain will be thrown out,
All the host of heaven will be dissolved,
For My sword is satiated [with blood] in heaven;
The sword of the L ord is filled with blood [from sacrifices],
Wild oxen will also fall with them
For the L ord has a day of vengeance,
The streams [of Edom] will be turned into pitch,
The burning will not be quenched night or day;
But the pelican and the porcupine will take possession of it;
Its nobles—there is no one there
Thorns will come up in its fortified palaces,
The creatures of the desert will encounter jackals
There the arrow snake will make her nest and lay her eggs,
Seek from the book of the L ord , and read:
The L ord has cast the lot for them,

35.verse_text: The wilderness and the dry land will be glad; The Arabah (desert) will shout in exultation and blossom And rejoice with joy and singing. The glory of Lebanon will be given to it, The majesty of [Mount] Carmel and [the plain] of Sharon. They will see the glory of the L ord , The majesty and splendor of our God. “Be strong, fear not! Indeed, your God will come with vengeance [for the ungodly]; The retribution of God will come, But He will save you.” And the ears of the deaf will be unstopped. And the tongue of the mute will shout for joy. For waters will break forth in the wilderness And streams in the desert. And the thirsty ground springs of water; And it will be called the Holy Way. The unclean will not travel on it, But it will be for those who walk on the way [the redeemed]; And fools will not wander on it . Nor will any predatory animal come up on it; They will not be found there. But the redeemed will walk there . And come to Zion with shouts of jubilation, And everlasting joy will be upon their heads; They will find joy and gladness, And sorrow and sighing will flee away. Like the autumn crocus. In the haunt of jackals, where they lay resting, Grass becomes reeds and rushes.
Encourage the exhausted, and make staggering knees firm.
Say to those with an anxious and panic-stricken heart,
Then the eyes of the blind will be opened
Then the lame will leap like a deer,
And the burning sand (mirage) will become a pool [of water]
A highway will be there, and a roadway;
And the ransomed of the L ord will return

36.verse_text: Now in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and conquered them.

And the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh [his military commander] from Lachish [the Judean fortress commanding the road from Egypt] to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem with a large army. And he stood by the canal of the Upper Pool on the highway to the Fuller’s Field.
Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the [royal] household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recording historian, came out to [meet] him.
Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say to Hezekiah, ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria says, “What is [the reason for] this confidence that you have?
I say, ‘Your plan and strength for the war are only empty words.’ Now in whom do you trust and on whom do you rely, that you have rebelled against me?
Listen carefully, you rely on the staff of this broken reed, Egypt, which will pierce the hand of any man who leans on it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who rely on him.

But if you say to me, ‘We trust in and rely on the L ord our God,’ is it not He whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, saying to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar’?
So now, exchange pledges with my master the king of Assyria and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to put riders on them.
How then can you repulse [the attack of] a single commander of the least of my master’s servants, and rely on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
Moreover, is it without the L ord that I have now come up against this land to destroy it? The L ord said to me, ‘Go up against this land and destroy it.’ ” ’ ”

Then Eliakim and Shebna and Joah said to the Rabshakeh, “Please, speak to your servants in Aramaic, because we understand it; and do not speak to us in Judean (Hebrew) in the hearing of the people who are [stationed] on the wall.”

But the Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me to speak these words only to your master and to you, and not to the men sitting on the wall, doomed to eat their own dung and drink their own urine with you?”
Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out with a loud voice in Judean (Hebrew): “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.
This is what the king says, ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to rescue you;
nor let Hezekiah make you trust in the L ord , saying, “The L ord will most certainly rescue us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”

Do not listen to Hezekiah,’ for this is what the king of Assyria says, ‘Make peace with me and come out to me, and each one of you will eat from his own vine and each from his own fig tree and each [one of you] drink from the water of his own cistern,
until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
Beware that Hezekiah does not mislead you by saying, “The L ord will rescue us.” Has any one of the gods of the nations [ever] rescued his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad [in Aram]? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? And when have they rescued Samaria from my hand?
Who among all the gods of these lands have rescued their land from my hand, that [you should think that] the L ord would rescue Jerusalem from my hand?’ ”
But they kept silent and did not say a word to him in reply, for King Hezekiah’s command was, “Do not answer him.”

Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the household, and Shebna the scribe and Joah the son of Asaph, the recording historian, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn [in grief], and told him the words of the Rabshakeh [the Assyrian commander].

37.verse_text: And when King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the house of the L ord .
Then he sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the [royal] household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
They said to him, “This is what Hezekiah says, ‘This day is a day of distress, rebuke and disgrace; for children have come to birth, and there is no strength to deliver them.

It may be that the L ord your God will hear the words of the Rabshakeh [the commander], whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to taunt and defy the living God, and will avenge the words which the L ord your God has heard. Therefore, offer a prayer for the remnant [of His people] that is left.’ ” “She has shown contempt for you and mocked you, The Virgin Daughter of Zion (Jerusalem); She has shaken her head behind you, The Daughter of Jerusalem! And against whom have you raised your voice And haughtily lifted up your eyes? Against the Holy One of Israel! And you have said, ‘With my many chariots I have gone up to the heights of the mountains, To the remotest parts of Lebanon. I cut down its tallest cedars and its choicest cypress trees; And I will go to its remotest height, its most luxuriant and thickest forest. And with the sole of my feet I dried up All the canals [of the Nile] of Egypt.’ That I did it long ago, That I planned it in ancient times? Now I have brought it to pass, That you [king of Assyria] would [be My instrument to] turn fortified cities into ruinous heaps. They were terrorized and shamed; They were like the grass of the field and the green vegetation, Like grass on the housetops and like a field [of grain] scorched before it is grown. And your going out and your coming in [every detail of your life], And your raging against Me. And your arrogance has come up to My ears, I will put My hook in your nose And I will turn you back by the way you came.
So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

Isaiah said to them, “You shall say the following to your master: ‘This is what the L ord says, “Do not be afraid because of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
Listen carefully, I will put a spirit in him so that he will hear a rumor and return to his own land. And I will make him fall by the sword in his own land.” ’ ”
So the Rabshakeh returned and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah [a fortified city of Judah], for he had heard that the king had left Lachish.
And Sennacherib king of Assyria, heard them say concerning Tirhakah king of Cush (Ethiopia), “He has come out to fight against you.” And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
“You shall say to Hezekiah king of Judah, ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
Listen carefully, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, utterly destroying them. So will you be rescued?
Did the gods of the nations which my fathers destroyed rescue them— Gozan, Haran [of Mesopotamia], Rezeph, and the sons of Eden who were in Telassar?
Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad [of northern Syria], the king of the city of Sepharvaim, [the king of] Hena, or [the king of] Ivvah?’ ”
Then Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it, and he went up to the house of the L ord and spread it out before the L ord .
And Hezekiah prayed to the L ord saying,
“O L ord of hosts, God of Israel, who is enthroned above the cherubim, You are the God, You alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.
Incline Your ear, O L ord , and hear; open Your eyes, O L ord , and see; and hear all the words of Sennacherib that he has sent to taunt and defy the living God.
It is true, O L ord , that the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the countries and their lands,
and have cast the gods [of those peoples] into the fire, for they were not gods but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone. Therefore they have destroyed them.
Now, O L ord our God, save us from his hand so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know and fully realize that You alone, L ord , are God.”
Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent word to Hezekiah, saying, “For the L ord , the God of Israel says this, ‘Because you have prayed to Me about Sennacherib king of Assyria,
this is the word that the L ord has spoken against him:
Whom have you taunted and blasphemed?
Through your servants you have taunted and defied the Lord,
I dug wells and drank [foreign] waters,
Have you not heard [says the God of Israel]
Therefore their inhabitants had little power,
But I know your sitting down
Because your raging against Me And My bridle in your mouth,

“This shall be the sign [of these things] to you [Hezekiah]: you are to eat this year what grows of itself, and in the second year that which springs from the same, and in the third year you are to sow and harvest, and plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
The surviving remnant of the house of Judah will again take root downward and bear fruit upward.
For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant and from Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the L ord of hosts will do this.” ’
“Therefore, the L ord says this concerning the king of Assyria, ‘He will not come into this city or shoot an arrow there, or come before it with shield, or raise an assault ramp against it.
By the way that he came, by the same way he will return, and he will not come into this city,’ declares the L ord .
‘For I will defend this city to save it, for My own sake and for the sake of My servant David.’ ”
And the angel of the L ord went out and struck 185,000 in the camp of the Assyrians; and when the [surviving] men got up early the next morning, they saw all the dead.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and returned and lived at Nineveh.

It came to pass as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons killed him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat [in Armenia]. And Esarhaddon his son became king in his place.

38.verse_text: In those days Hezekiah [king of Judah] became sick and was at the point of death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him and said, “For the L ord says this, ‘Set your house in order and prepare a will, for you shall die; you will not live.’ ”
Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the L ord ,

and said, “Please, O L ord , just remember how I have walked before You in faithfulness and truth, and with a whole heart [absolutely devoted to You], and have done what is good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept greatly. I am to go through the gates of Sheol (the place of the dead), I am to be summoned, deprived of the remainder of my years.” The L ord in the land of the living; I will no longer see man among the inhabitants of the world. I have rolled up my life as a weaver [rolls up the finished web]. He cuts me free from the warp [of the loom]; From day to night You bring me to an end. Like a lion, so He breaks all my bones; From day until night You bring me to an end. I coo like a dove. My eyes look wistfully upward; O Lord, I am oppressed, take my side and be my security. For He has spoken to me, and He Himself has done it; I will wander aimlessly all my years because of the bitterness of my soul. And in all these is the life of my spirit; Restore me to health and let me live! But You have loved back my life from the pit of nothingness (destruction), For You have cast all my sins behind Your back. Death cannot praise You and rejoice in You; Those who go down to the pit cannot hope for Your faithfulness. A father tells his sons about Your faithfulness. Therefore we will play my songs on stringed instruments All the days of our lives at the house of the L ord .”
Then the word of the L ord came to Isaiah, saying,
“Go and say to Hezekiah, ‘For the L ord , the God of David your father says this, “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; listen carefully, I will add fifteen years to your life.
I will rescue you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city [Jerusalem].” ’
“This shall be the sign to you from the L ord , that the L ord will do this thing that He has spoken:

Listen carefully, I will turn the shadow on the stairway [denoting the time of day] ten steps backward, the shadow on the stairway ( sundial) of Ahaz.” And the sunlight went ten steps backward on the stairway where it had [previously] gone down.
This is the writing of Hezekiah king of Judah after he had been sick and had recovered from his illness:
I said, “In mid-life
I said, “I will not see the L ord ,
My dwelling (body) is pulled up and removed from me like a shepherd’s tent;
I lay down until morning.
Like a swallow, like a crane, so I chirp;
“What shall I say?
O Lord, by these things men live,
Indeed, it was for my own well-being that I had such bitterness;
For Sheol cannot praise or thank You,
It is the living who give praise and thanks to You, as I do today;
The L ord is ready to save me;
Now Isaiah had said, “Have them take a cake of figs and rub it [as an ointment] on the inflamed spot, that he may recover.”
Hezekiah also had said, “What is the sign that I will go up to the house of the L ord ?”

39.verse_text: At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent [messengers with] letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he had heard that he had been sick and had recovered.

Hezekiah was pleased and showed them his treasure house—the silver, the gold, the spices, the precious oil, his entire armory and everything that was found in his treasuries. There was nothing in his house nor in all his area of dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and asked, “What did these men say? From where have they come to you?” And Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”
Then Isaiah said, “What have they seen in your house?” And Hezekiah answered, “They have seen everything that is in my house; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”
Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the L ord of hosts,

‘Listen carefully, the days are coming when everything that is in your house and everything that your predecessors have stored up until this day will be carried to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the L ord .
‘And some of your own sons (descendants) who will come from you, whom you will father, will be taken away, and they will become officials in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”
Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, “The word of the L ord which you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “There will be peace and faithfulness [to God’s promises to us] in my days.”

40.verse_text: “Comfort, O comfort My people,” says your God. And call out to her, that her time of compulsory service in warfare is finished, That her wickedness has been taken away [since her punishment is sufficient], That she has received from the L ord ’ s hand Double [punishment] for all her sins.” “Clear the way for the L ord in the wilderness [remove the obstacles]; Make straight and smooth in the desert a highway for our God. And every mountain and hill be made low; And let the rough ground become a plain, And the rugged places a broad valley. And all humanity shall see it together; For the mouth of the L ord has spoken it.” Then he answered, “What shall I call out?” [The voice answered:] All humanity is [as frail as] grass, and all that makes it attractive [its charm, its loveliness] is [momentary] like the flower of the field. When the breath of the L ord blows upon it; Most certainly [all] the people are [like] grass. But the word of our God stands forever. Get up on a high mountain. O Jerusalem, herald of good news, Lift up your voice with strength, Lift it up, do not fear; Say to the cities of Judah, “Here is your God!” And His arm will rule for Him. Most certainly His reward is with Him, And His restitution accompanies Him. He will gather the lambs in His arm, He will carry them in His bosom; He will gently and carefully lead those nursing their young. And marked off the heavens with a span [of the hand], And weighed the mountains in a balance And the hills in a pair of scales? Or has taught Him as His counselor? Who taught Him the path of justice and taught Him knowledge And informed Him of the way of understanding? And are regarded as a speck of dust on the scales; Now look, He lifts up the islands like fine dust. Nor are its wild beasts enough for a burnt offering [worthy of the L ord ]. They are regarded by Him as less than nothing and meaningless. Or with what likeness will you compare Him? A goldsmith overlays it with gold And a silversmith casts its silver chains. Chooses a tree that will not rot; He seeks out for himself a skillful craftsman To [carve and] set up an idol that will not totter. Has it not been told to you from the beginning? Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth [the omnipotence of God and the stupidity of bowing to idols]? And its inhabitants are like grasshoppers; [It is He] who stretches out the heavens like a veil And spreads them out like a tent to dwell in. Who makes the judges (rulers) of the earth meaningless (useless). Scarcely have they been sown, Scarcely has their stock taken root in the earth, But He merely blows on them, and they wither, And a strong wind carries them away like stubble. That I would be his equal?” says the Holy One. And see who has created these heavenly bodies, The One who brings out their host by number, He calls them all by name; Because of the greatness of His might and the strength of His power, Not one is missing. “My way is hidden from the L ord , And the justice due me escapes the notice of my God”? The Everlasting God, the L ord , the Creator of the ends of the earth Does not become tired or grow weary; There is no searching of His understanding. And to him who has no might He increases power. And vigorous young men stumble badly, Will gain new strength and renew their power; They will lift up their wings [and rise up close to God] like eagles [rising toward the sun]; They will run and not become weary, They will walk and not grow tired.
“Speak tenderly to Jerusalem,
A voice of one is calling out,
Every valley shall be raised,
And the glory and majesty and splendor of the L ord will be revealed,
A voice says, “Call out [prophesy].”
The grass withers, the flower fades,
The grass withers, the flower fades,
O Zion, herald of good news,
Listen carefully, the Lord G od will come with might,
He will protect His flock like a shepherd,
Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, And calculated the dust of the earth with a measure,
Who has directed the Spirit of the L ord ,
With whom did He consult and who enlightened Him?
In fact, the nations are like a drop from a bucket,
And [the forests of] Lebanon cannot supply sufficient fuel to start a fire,
All the nations are as nothing before Him,
To whom then will you liken God?
As for the cast image (idol), a metalworker casts it,
He who is too impoverished for such an offering [to give to his god]
Do you [who worship idols] not know? Have you not heard?
It is He who sits above the circle of the earth,
It is He who reduces dignitaries to nothing,
Scarcely have they been planted,
“To whom then will you compare Me
Lift up your eyes on high
Why, O Jacob, do you say, and declare, O Israel,
Do you not know? Have you not heard?
He gives strength to the weary,
Even youths grow weary and tired,
But those who wait for the L ord [who expect, look for, and hope in Him]

41.verse_text: “Listen to Me in silence, you islands and coastlands, And let the nations gain their strength; Let them come near, then let them speak; Let us come together for judgment [and decide the issue between us concerning the enemy from the east]. Whom He calls in righteousness to His service and whom victory meets at every step? The L ord turns nations over to him And subdues kings. He makes them like dust with his sword, Like wind-driven chaff with his bow. By a way his feet had not traveled before. Calling forth [and guiding the destinies of] the generations [of the nations] from the beginning? ‘I, the L ord —the first, and with the last [existing before history began, the ever-present, unchanging God]—I am He.’ ” The ends of the earth tremble; They have drawn near and have come. And say to his brother [as he fashions his idols], “Be of good courage!” And he who smooths metal with the smith’s hammer encourages him who beats the anvil, Saying of the soldering (welding), “That is good”; And he fastens the idol with nails, So that it will not totter nor be moved. Jacob whom I have chosen, The offspring of Abraham My friend, And called from its remotest parts And said to you, ‘You are My servant, I have chosen you and have not rejected you [even though you are exiled]. Do not be afraid, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, be assured I will help you; I will certainly take hold of you with My righteous right hand [a hand of justice, of power, of victory, of salvation].’ Those who strive against you will be as nothing and will perish. They who war against you will be as nothing, as nothing at all. Who says to you, ‘Do not fear, I will help you.’ I will help you,” declares the L ord , “and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel. You will thresh the mountains and crush them, And make the hills like chaff. And a high wind will scatter them; But you will rejoice in the L ord , You will glory in the Holy One of Israel. Their tongues are parched with thirst. I, the L ord , will answer them Myself; I, the God of Israel, will not neglect them. And springs in the midst of the valleys; I will make the wilderness a reed-pool of water And the dry land springs of water. The acacia, the myrtle and the olive tree; I will place the juniper in the desert Together with the box tree and the cypress, And consider and understand together, That the hand of the L ord has done this, That the Holy One of Israel has created it. “Produce your evidence [of divinity],” Says the king of Jacob. Regarding the former events, tell what they were, That we may consider them and know their outcome; Or announce to us the things that are going to come. That we may know that you are gods; And your work is worthless; The worshiper who chooses you [as a god] is repulsive. From the rising of the sun he will call on My Name [in prayer]. And he will trample on [the Babylonian] officials as on mortar, Even as a potter treads clay.” Or from earlier times, so that we could say, “He is [unquestionably] right!”? In fact, there was no one who declared it, Indeed, there was no one who proclaimed it; There was no one at all who heard you speak [for you pagan gods are speechless]. Who, if I ask, can give an answer. Their works are worthless, Their cast images are [merely] wind and emptiness.
Who has stirred up and put into action one from the east [the king of Persia, Cyrus the Great]
He (Cyrus) pursues them and passes along safely,
Who has performed and done this,
The islands and coastlands have seen and they fear;
They each help his neighbor
So the craftsman encourages the goldsmith,
“But you, Israel, My servant,
You whom I [the L ord ] have taken from the ends of the earth,
Do not fear [anything], for I am with you;
Indeed, all those who are angry with you will be put to shame and humiliated;
You shall search for those who quarrel with you, but will not find them;
For I the L ord your God keep hold of your right hand; [I am the Lord],
Do not fear, you worm Jacob, you men of Israel;
In fact, I have made of you a new, sharp threshing implement with sharp edges;
You will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away,
“The poor and needy are seeking water, but there is none;
I will open rivers on the barren heights
I will put the cedar in the wilderness,
So that they may see and know,
“Present your case [for idols made by men’s hands],” says the L ord .
Let them bring forward [their evidence] and tell us what is going to happen.

Tell us the things that are to come afterward, Indeed, you should do something good or do evil, that we may be afraid and fear [you] together [as we observe the miracle]. And to Jerusalem, ‘I will provide a messenger (Isaiah) to bring the good news [ that Cyrus will be stirred up and put into action to save them].’ And there is no counselor among them,
Hear this! You [idols] are less than nothing,
“I have stirred up and put into action one from the north [the king of Persia, Cyrus the Great], and he has come;
Who [among the idols] has declared this from the beginning, so that we could know?
“I was first to say to Zion, ‘Listen carefully, here they are [the Jews who will be restored to their own land].’
But when I look [on the pagan prophets and priests], there is no one [who could predict these events],
In fact, all of these [pagan prophets and priests] are false;

42.verse_text: “Behold, My Servant, whom I uphold; My Chosen One in whom My soul delights. I have put My Spirit upon Him; He will bring forth justice to the nations. Nor make His voice heard in the street. And a dimly burning wick He will not extinguish [He will not harm those who are weak and suffering]; He will faithfully bring forth justice. [He will persevere] until He has established justice on the earth; And the coastlands will wait expectantly for His law.” He who created the heavens and stretched them out, Who spread out the earth and its produce, Who gives breath to the people on it And spirit to those who walk on it, I will also take You by the hand and keep watch over You, And I will appoint You as a covenant to the people [Israel], As a light to the nations (Gentiles), To bring out prisoners from the dungeon And those who sit in darkness from the prison. My glory I will not give to another, Nor My praise to carved idols. Now I declare new things; Before they spring forth I proclaim them to you.” Sing His praise from the end of the earth! You who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, You islands and coastlands, and those who inhabit them [sing His praise]! The villages where Kedar lives. Let them shout joyfully from the tops of the mountains. And declare His praise in the islands and coastlands. He will stir up His zeal like a man of war; He will shout out, yes, He will raise a war cry. He will prevail [mightily] against His enemies. I have been still and restrained Myself. Now I will moan like a woman in labor, I will both gasp and pant. And wither all their vegetation; I will turn the rivers into coastlands And dry up the ponds. I will guide them in paths that they do not know. I will make darkness into light before them And rugged places into plains. These things I will do [for them], And I will not leave them abandoned or undone.” And utterly put to shame, Who say to cast images, “You are our gods.” And look, you blind, that you may see. Or deaf like My messenger whom I send? Who is blind like the one who is at peace with Me [in a covenant relationship], Or so blind as the servant of the L ord ? Your ears are open, but no one hears. To make the law great and prove to be glorious. All of them are trapped in holes, Or are hidden away in prisons. They have become a prey with no one to rescue them, And a spoil, with no one to say, “Give them back!” Who will listen and pay attention in the time to come? Was it not the L ord , He against whom we [of Judah] have sinned, And in whose ways they [of Israel] were unwilling to walk, And whose law and teaching they did not obey? And the fierceness of battle; And engulfed him in fire, Yet he did not recognize [the lesson of repentance which the Assyrian conquest was intended to teach]; It burned him, but he did not take it to heart.
He will not call out or shout aloud,
A broken reed He will not break [off]
He will not be disheartened or crushed [in spirit];
This is what God the L ord says,
“I am the L ord , I have called You (the Messiah) in righteousness [for a righteous purpose],
To open the eyes of the blind,
I am the L ord , that is My Name;
Indeed, the former things have come to pass,
Sing to the L ord a new song,
Let the wilderness and its cities lift up their voices, Let the inhabitants of Sela shout for joy,
Let them give glory to the L ord
The L ord will go forth like a warrior,
“I [the L ord ] have been silent for a long time,
I will lay waste the mountains and hills
I will lead the blind by a way they do not know;
Those who trust in carved idols will be turned back,
Hear, you deaf!
Who is blind but My servant [Israel],
You have seen many things, but you do not observe them;
The L ord was pleased for His righteousness’ sake
But this is a people despoiled and plundered;
Who among you will listen to this?
Who gave up Jacob [the kingdom of Judah] for spoil, and [the kingdom of] Israel to the plunderers?
Therefore He poured out on Israel the heat of His anger

43.verse_text: But now, this is what the L ord , your Creator says, O Jacob, And He who formed you, O Israel, “Do not fear, for I have redeemed you [from captivity]; I have called you by name; you are Mine! And through the rivers, they will not overwhelm you. When you walk through fire, you will not be scorched, Nor will the flame burn you. The Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I have given Egypt [to the Babylonians] as your ransom, Cush (ancient Ethiopia) and Seba [its province] in exchange for you. You are honored and I love you, I will give other men in return for you and other peoples in exchange for your life. I will bring your offspring from the east [where they are scattered], And gather you from the west. And to the south, ‘Do not hold them back.’ Bring My sons from far way And My daughters from the ends of the earth, Whom I have created for My glory, Whom I have formed, even whom I have made.” And the deaf, even though they have ears. So that the peoples may be assembled. And proclaim to us the former events? Let them provide their witnesses so that they may be justified, Or let them hear and say [in acknowledgement], “It is the truth.” “And My servant whom I have chosen, That you may know and believe Me And understand that I am He. Before Me there was no God formed, And there will be none after Me. And there is no Savior besides Me. And there was no strange (alien) god among you; Therefore you are My witnesses [among the pagans],” declares the L ord , “That I am God. And there is no one who can rescue from My hand; I act, and who can revoke or reverse it?” “For your sake I have sent [one] to Babylon, And I will bring down all of them as fugitives, The Creator of Israel, your King.” He who makes a way through the sea And a path through the mighty waters, The army and the mighty warrior, (They will lie down together, they will not rise again; They have been extinguished, they have been put out like a lamp’s wick): Or ponder the things of the past. Now it will spring forth; Will you not be aware of it? I will even put a road in the wilderness, Rivers in the desert. Jackals and ostriches, Because I have given waters in the wilderness And rivers in the desert, To give drink to My people, My chosen. Will make known My praise. But you have grown weary of Me, O Israel. Nor honored Me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with offerings, Nor wearied you with [demands for offerings of] incense. Nor have you filled Me with the fat of your sacrifices; But you have burdened Me with your sins, You have wearied Me with your wickedness. And I will not remember your sins. State your position, that you may be proved right. And your spokesmen [the priests and the prophets—your mediators] have transgressed against Me. And I will consign Jacob to destruction and [I will subject] Israel to defamation and abuse.
When you pass through the waters, I will be with you;
For I am the L ord your God,
Because you are precious in My sight,
Do not fear, for I am with you;
I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’
Everyone who is called by My Name,
Bring out the people who are blind, even though they have eyes,

All the nations have gathered together Who among them (the idolaters) can predict this [that Judah would return from captivity] Even the Chaldeans [who reign in Babylon], into the ships over which they rejoiced.
“You are My witnesses,” declares the L ord ,
I, [only] I, am the L ord ,
I have declared [the future] and saved [the nation] and proclaimed [that I am God],
Even from eternity I am He,
This is what the L ord your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says,
I am the L ord , your Holy One,
This is what the L ord says,
He who brings out the chariot and the horse,
“Do not remember the former things,
Listen carefully, I am about to do a new thing,
The beasts of the field will honor Me,
The people whom I formed for Myself
“Yet you have not called on Me [in prayer and worship], O Jacob;
You have not brought Me your sheep or goats for your burnt offerings,
You have not bought Me sweet cane with money,
“I, only I, am He who wipes out your transgressions for My own sake,
Remind Me [of your merits with a thorough report], let us plead and argue our case together;
Your first father [Jacob] sinned,
So I will profane the officials of the sanctuary,

44.verse_text: “But now listen, O Jacob, My servant, And Israel, whom I have chosen: And formed you from the womb, who will help you says, ‘Fear not, O Jacob My servant; And Jeshurun (Israel, the upright one) whom I have chosen. And streams on the dry ground; I will pour out My Spirit on your offspring And My blessing on your descendants; Like willows by the streams of water.’ And another will name himself after Jacob; And another will write on his hand, ‘I am the L ord ’ s ,’ And be called by the [honorable] name of Israel. ‘I am the First and I am the Last; And there is no God besides Me. Yes, let him confront Me, Since I established the people of antiquity. And let them [those supposed gods] tell those people [who foolishly follow them] the things to come And the events that are going to take place. Have I not long ago proclaimed it to you and declared it? And you are My witnesses. Is there a God besides Me? There is no other Rock; I know of none.’ ” And Israel, for you are My servant! I formed you, you are My servant; O Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me. And your sins like a heavy mist. Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.” Shout in triumph, you depths of the earth; Break forth into jubilant rejoicing, you mountains, O forest, and every tree in it! For the L ord has redeemed Jacob, And He shows His glory in Israel. “I am the L ord , Maker of all things, Who alone stretches out the heavens, Counteracting the wise And making their knowledge ridiculous, And carrying out the plan of His messengers. It is I who says of Jerusalem, ‘She shall [again] be inhabited!’ And of the cities of Judah, ‘They shall [again] be built.’ And I will raise up and restore her ruins. And I will make your rivers dry. And he will carry out all that I desire—’ Saying of Jerusalem, ‘She shall [again] be built,’ And of the temple, ‘Your foundation shall [again] be laid.’ ”
This is what the L ord who made you
For I will pour out water on him who is thirsty,
And they will spring up among the grass
One will say, ‘I am the L ord ’ s ’;
“For the L ord , the King of Israel and his Redeemer, the L ord of hosts says this,
Who is like Me? Let him proclaim it and declare it;
Do not tremble nor be afraid [of the violent upheavals to come];
All who make carved idols are nothing. Their precious objects are worthless [to them], and their own witnesses (worshipers) fail to see or know, so that they will be put to shame.
Who has made a god or cast an idol which is profitable for nothing?
In fact, all his companions will be put to shame, for the craftsmen themselves are mere men. Let them all assemble, let them stand up, let them be terrified, let them together be put to shame.

The ironsmith shapes iron and uses a chisel and works it over the coals. He forms the [idol’s] core with hammers and works it with his strong arm. He also becomes hungry and his strength fails; he drinks no water and grows tired.

The carpenter stretches out a measuring line, he marks out the shape [of the idol] with red chalk; he works it with planes and outlines it with the compass; and he makes it like the form of a man, like the beauty of man, that it may sit in a house.
He cuts cedars for himself, and takes a cypress or an oak and lets it grow strong for himself among the trees of the forest. He plants a fir, and the rain nourishes it.

Then it becomes fuel for a man to burn, so he takes one of them and warms himself; he also kindles a fire to bake bread. He also makes a god [from the same wood] and worships it. He makes it into a carved idol [with his own hands] and falls down and worships it!
He burns half of the wood in the fire; over this half he [cooks and] eats meat, he roasts meat and is satisfied. Also he warms himself and says, “Aha! I am warm, I have seen the fire.”
But from what is left of the wood he makes a god, his carved idol. He falls down before it, he worships it and prays to it and says, “Save me, for you are my god.”
They do not know, nor do they understand, for God has muddied their eyes so that they cannot see, and their hearts (minds) as well so that they cannot understand.

No one remembers, nor has knowledge and understanding [enough] to say [to himself], “I have burned half of this log in the fire, and also baked bread on its coals and have roasted meat and eaten it. Then I make the rest of it into an repulsive thing [to God]; I bow down [to worship] before a block of wood!”

That kind of man (the idolater) feeds on ashes [and is satisfied with ashes]! A deceived mind has led him astray, so that he cannot save himself, or ask, “Is this thing [that I am holding] in my right hand not a lie?”
“Remember [the foolishness of] these things, O Jacob
I have wiped out your transgressions like a thick cloud
Shout for joy, O heavens, for the L ord has done it!
For the L ord , your Redeemer, and He who formed you from the womb says this, Who spreads out the earth by Myself, Making fools out of fortune-tellers,
Frustrating the signs and confounding the omens of boasters (false prophets),
Confirming the word of His servant
It is I who says to the deep, ‘Be dried up!’
It is I who says of Cyrus, ‘He is My shepherd (ruler),

45.verse_text: This is what the L ord says to His anointed, to Cyrus [king of Persia], Whose right hand I have held To subdue nations before him, And I will ungird the loins of kings [disarming them]; To open doors before him so that gates will not be shut: I will shatter the doors of bronze and cut through the bars of iron. And the hidden riches of secret places, So that you may know that it is I, The L ord , the God of Israel, who calls you (Cyrus the Great) by your name. And of Israel My chosen, I have also called you by your name; I have given you an honorable name Though you have not known Me. There is no God except Me. I will embrace and arm you, though you have not known Me, That there is no one except Me. I am the L ord , and there is no other, Causing peace and creating disaster; I am the L ord who does all these things. Let the clouds pour down righteousness [all the blessings of God]; Let the earth open up, let salvation bear fruit, And righteousness spring up with it; I, the L ord , have created it. A [worthless] piece of broken pottery among other broken pieces [equally worthless]! Shall the clay say to the potter, ‘What are you doing?’ Or does the thing say, ‘He has no hands’? Or to a woman, ‘With what are you in labor?’ ” “Ask Me about the things to come concerning My sons, And give Me orders concerning the work of My hands. My hands, stretched out the heavens, And I commanded all their host. And I will make all his ways smooth; He will build My city and let My exiles go, Without any payment or reward,” says the L ord of hosts. “The products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush (ancient Ethiopia) And the Sabeans, men of stature, Will come over to you and they will be yours; They will walk behind you, in chains [of subjection to you] they will come over, And they will bow down before you; They will make supplication to you, [humbly and earnestly] saying, No other God [besides Him].’ ” O God of Israel, Savior! They who make idols will go away together in humiliation. With an everlasting salvation; You will not be put to shame or humiliated for all eternity. “I am the L ord , and there is no one else. In a corner of a land of darkness; I did not say to the descendants of Jacob, ‘Seek Me in vain [with no benefit for yourselves].’ I, the L ord , speak righteousness [the truth—trustworthy, a straightforward correlation between deeds and words], Declaring things that are upright. Come together, you survivors of the nations! They are ignorant, Who carry around their wooden idols [in religious processions or into battle] And keep on praying to a god that cannot save them. Indeed, let them consult together. Who announced this [rise of Cyrus and his conquests] long before it happened? Who declared it long ago? Was it not I, the L ord ? And there is no other God besides Me, A [consistently and uncompromisingly] just and righteous God and a Savior; There is none except Me. For I am God, and there is no other. The word is gone out of My mouth in righteousness And shall not return, That to Me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear [allegiance]. To Him people will come, And all who were angry at Him will be put to shame. Will be justified (declared free of guilt) and will glory [in God].”
“I will go before you and level the mountains;
I will give you the treasures of darkness [the hoarded treasures]
For the sake of Jacob My servant,
I am the L ord , and there is no one else;
That people may know from the rising to the setting of the sun [the world over]
The One forming light and creating darkness,
“Rain down, O heavens, from above,
“Woe (judgment is coming) to him who quarrels with his Maker—
Woe (judgment is coming) to him who says to a father, ‘What are you fathering?’
For the L ord , the Holy One of Israel, and its Maker says this,
I made the earth and created man upon it.
I have stirred up Cyrus and put him into action in righteousness [to accomplish My purpose]
For this is what the L ord says, ‘Most certainly God is with you, and there is no other,
Truly, You are a God who hides Himself,
They will be put to shame and also humiliated, all of them;
Israel has been saved by the L ord
For the L ord , who created the heavens (He is God, who formed the earth and made it; He established it and did not create it to be a wasteland, but formed it to be inhabited) says this,
I have not spoken in secret,
“Assemble yourselves and come;
Declare and present your defense of idols;
Turn to Me and be saved, all the ends of the earth;
I have sworn [an oath] by Myself,
It shall be said of Me, ‘Only in the L ord are righteousness and strength.’
In the L ord all the offspring of Israel

46.verse_text: Bel has bowed down, Nebo stoops over; Their idols are on the beasts [of burden] and on the cattle. Your burdens [of idols] are loaded [on them], Burdens on the weary animals . They could not rescue the burden [of their own idols], But have themselves gone into captivity. And all the remnant of the house of Israel, You who have been carried by Me from your birth And have been carried [in My arms] from the womb, And even to your advanced old age I will carry you! I have made you, and I will carry you; Be assured I will carry you and I will save you . And make Me equal and compare Me, That we may be alike? And weigh out silver on the scales Hire a goldsmith, and he makes it into a god; They bow down, indeed they worship it. They set it in its place and there it remains standing. It cannot move from its place. Even if one cries to it [for help], the idol cannot answer; It cannot save him from his distress. Take it to heart, you rebellious and disloyal people. For I am God, and there is no one else; I am God, and there is no one like Me, And from ancient times the things which have not [yet] been done, Saying, ‘My purpose will be established, And I will do all that pleases Me and fulfills My purpose,’ From a far country, the man (Cyrus) of My purpose. Truly I have spoken; truly I will bring it to pass. I have planned it, be assured I will do it. You who are far from righteousness (right standing with God). And My salvation will not delay. And I will grant salvation in Zion, And My glory for Israel.
They stooped over, they have bowed down together;
“Listen to Me,” [says the L ord ], “O house of Jacob,
Even to your old age I am He,
Those who lavish gold from the bag
They lift it on their shoulders [in religious processions or into battle] and carry it;
Remember [carefully] the former things [which I did] from ages past;
Declaring the end and the result from the beginning,
Calling a bird of prey from the east,
I bring near My righteousness [in the salvation of Israel], it is not far away;

47.verse_text: “Come down and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon; Sit on the ground [in abject humiliation]; there is no throne for you, For you will no longer be called tender and delicate. Remove your veil, strip off the skirt, Uncover the leg, cross the rivers [at the command of your captors]. Your shame will also be exposed; I will take vengeance and will spare no man.” The Holy One of Israel. O daughter of the Chaldeans; For you will no longer be called The queen of kingdoms. I profaned [Judah] My inheritance And gave them into your hand [Babylon]. You showed them no mercy; You made your yoke very heavy on the aged. You did not consider these things, Nor did you [seriously] remember the [ultimate] outcome of such conduct. You who dwell safely and securely, Who say in your heart (mind), ‘I am [the queen], and there is no one besides me. I shall not sit as a widow, Nor know the loss of children.’ Loss of children and widowhood. They will come on you in full measure In spite of your many [claims of power through your] sorceries, In spite of the great power of your enchantments. ‘No one sees me.’ Your wisdom and your knowledge have led you astray, And you have said in your heart (mind), ‘I am, and there is no one besides me.’ You will not know how to make it disappear [with your magic]. And disaster will fall on you For which you cannot atone [with all your offerings to your gods]; And destruction about which you do not know Will come on you suddenly. And your many sorceries With which you have labored from your youth; Perhaps you will be able to profit [from them], Perhaps you may prevail and cause trembling. Just let the astrologers, The stargazers, Those who predict by the new moons [each month] Stand up and save you from the things that will come upon you [Babylon]. Fire burns them. They cannot save themselves from the power of the flame [much less save the nation], There is no blazing coal for warming Nor fire before which to sit! Those who have done business with you from your youth; Each has wandered in his own way. There is no one to save you. O daughter of the Chaldeans,
Take millstones [as a female slave does] and grind meal;
Our Redeemer [will do all this], the L ord of hosts is His name,
“Sit in silence, and go into darkness,
I was angry with My people,
And you said, ‘I shall be a queen forevermore.’
“Now, then, hear this, you who live a luxuriant life,
But these two things shall come to you abruptly, in one day:
For you [Babylon] have trusted and felt confident in your wickedness; you have said,
Therefore disaster will come on you;
You are wearied by your many counsels.
In fact, they are like stubble;
