This is how they have become to you, those [astrologers and sorcerers] with whom you have labored,

48.verse_text: “Hear this, O house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel And who come from the seed of Judah, Even hidden things which you have not known. You who swear [allegiance] by the name of the L ord And invoke the God of Israel, But not in truth (sincerity) nor in righteousness [with moral and spiritual integrity]. And depend on the God of Israel; The L ord of hosts is His name. They went forth from My mouth and I proclaimed them; Suddenly I acted, and they came to pass. And your neck is an iron tendon And your brow is bronze [both unyielding], Before they came to pass I announced them to you, So that you could not say, ‘My idol has done them, And my carved image and my cast image have commanded them.’ And you, will you not declare it? I proclaim to you [specific] new things from this time, And before today you have not heard of them, So that you will not say, ‘Oh yes! I knew them.’ Even from long ago your ear has not been open. For I [the L ord ] knew that you [Israel] would act very treacherously; You have been called a transgressor and a rebel from birth. And for My praise I restrain Myself from you, So that I do not cut you off. I have tested and chosen you in the furnace of affliction. For how can My Name be defiled and profaned [as it would if My chosen people were completely destroyed]? And I will not give My glory to another [by permitting the worshipers of idols to triumph over you]. I am He, I am the First, I am the Last. And My right hand spread out the heavens; When I call to them, they stand together [in obedience to carry out My decrees]. Who among them [the idols and Chaldean astrologers] has declared these things? The L ord loves him (Cyrus of Persia); he will do His pleasure and purpose against Babylon, And his arm will be against the Chaldeans [who reign in Babylon]. I have brought him, and will make his way successful. From the beginning I have not spoken in secret, From the time that it happened, I was there. And now the Lord G od has sent Me, and His [Holy] Spirit.” “I am the L ord your God, who teaches you to profit (benefit), Who leads you in the way that you should go. Then your peace and prosperity would have been like a [flowing] river, And your righteousness [the holiness and purity of the nation] like the [abundant] waves of the sea. And your descendants [in number] like the grains of sand; Their name would never be cut off or destroyed from My presence.” Declare with a voice of jubilation, proclaim this, Send it out to the end of the earth; Say, “The L ord has redeemed His servant Jacob.” He made the waters flow out of the rock for them; He split the rock and the waters flowed.
For they call themselves [citizens of Jerusalem] after the holy city
I have declared the former things [which happened to Israel] in times past;
Because I know that you are obstinate,
I have declared them to you long ago;
You have heard [these things foretold]; look at all this [that has been fulfilled].
They are created now [called into being by the prophetic word] and not long ago;
You have not heard, you have not known;
For the sake of My Name I refrain from My wrath,
Indeed, I have refined you, but not as silver;
For My own sake, for My own sake, I will do it [I refrain and do not completely destroy you];
“Listen to Me, O Jacob, and Israel, whom I called;
My hand founded and established the earth,
Assemble, all of you, and listen!
I, even I, have spoken; indeed, I have called Cyrus;
Come near to Me, listen to this:
This is what the L ord , your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says,
Oh, that you had paid attention to My commandments!
Your offspring would have been like the sand,
Get out of Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans [who reign there]!
They did not thirst when He led them through the deserts.
“There is no peace for the wicked,” says the L ord .

49.verse_text: Listen to Me, O islands and coastlands, And pay attention, you peoples from far away. The L ord has called Me from the womb; From the body of My mother He has named Me. In the shadow of His hand He has kept Me hidden; And He has made Me a sharpened arrow, In His quiver He has hidden Me. In Whom I will show My glory.” I have spent My strength for nothing and vanity (pride, uselessness); However My justice is with the L ord , And My reward is with My God.” To bring Jacob back to Him and that Israel might be gathered to Him, —For I am honored in the eyes of the L ord , And My God is My strength— I will also make You a light to the nations That My salvation may reach to the end of the earth.” To the thoroughly despised One, To the One hated by the nation To the Servant of rulers, Princes shall also bow down, Because of the L ord who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel who has chosen You.” And in a day of salvation I have helped You; And I will keep watch over You and give You for a covenant of the people, To restore the land [from its present state of ruin] and to apportion and give as inheritances the deserted hereditary lands, And to those who are in [spiritual] darkness, ‘Show yourselves [come into the light of the Savior].’ They will feed along the roads [on which they travel], And their pastures will be on all the bare heights. Nor will the scorching heat or sun strike them down; For He who has compassion on them will lead them, And He will guide them to springs of water. And My highways will be raised. And, lo, these shall come from the north and from the west, And break forth into singing, O mountains! For the L ord has comforted His people And will have compassion on His afflicted. And my Lord has forgotten me.” And have no compassion on the son of her womb? Even these may forget, but I will not forget you. Your city walls [Zion] are continually before Me. Your destroyers and devastators Will go away from you. All these gather together and they come to you [to rebuild you]. As I live,” declares the L ord , “You [Zion] will indeed clothe yourself with all of them as jewels and tie them on as a bride. Certainly now [in the coming years] will be too cramped for the inhabitants, And those who once engulfed you will be far away. ‘The place is too cramped for me’; Make room for me that I may live here . ‘Who has borne me these children, Since I have been bereaved of my children And am barren, an exile and a wanderer? And who has reared these? Indeed, I was left alone; “Listen carefully, I will lift up My hand to the [Gentile] nations And set up My banner to the peoples; And they will bring your sons in the fold of their garments, And your daughters will be carried on their shoulders. And their princesses your nurses. They will bow down to you with their faces to the earth And lick the dust of your feet; And you shall know [with an understanding based on personal experience] that I am the L ord ; For they shall not be put to shame who wait and hope expectantly for Me. Or the captives of a tyrant be rescued?” “Even the captives of the mighty man will be taken away, And the tyrant’s spoils of war will be rescued; For I will contend with your opponent, And I will save your children. And they will become drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine; And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
He has made My mouth like a sharp sword,
And [the L ord ] said to Me, “You are My Servant, Israel,
Then I said, “I have labored in vain,
And now says the L ord , who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant,

He says, “It is too trivial a thing that You should be My Servant To raise up the tribes of Jacob and to restore the survivors of Israel; “ Kings will see and arise, “In a favorable time I have answered You, And these from the land of Aswan (southern Egypt).” From where then did these children come?’ ” And all mankind will know [with a knowledge grounded in personal experience] that I, the L ord , am your Savior
This is what the L ord , the Redeemer of Israel, Israel’s Holy One says,
This is what the L ord says,
Saying to those who are bound and captured, ‘Go forth,’
They will not hunger or thirst,
And I will make all My mountains a roadway,
In fact, these will come from far away;
Shout for joy, O heavens, and rejoice, O earth,
But Zion (Jerusalem in captivity) said, “The L ord has abandoned me,
[The L ord answered] “Can a woman forget her nursing child
Indeed, I have inscribed [a picture of] you on the palms of My hands;
Your builders hurry;
Lift up your eyes and look around [at the returning exiles];
For your ruins and desolate places and your land [once the scene] of destruction—
The children of your bereavement [those born in captivity] will yet say in your ears,
Then [Zion], you will say in your heart,
This is what the Lord G od says,
Kings will be your attendants,
“Can the spoils of war be taken from the mighty man,
Indeed, this is what the L ord says,
I will make those who oppress you consume their own flesh [in mutually destructive wars]

50.verse_text: The L ord declares this; “Where is the certificate of divorce By which I have sent your mother away, [O Israel]? Or to which one of My creditors did I sell you [as slaves]? In fact, You were sold for your wickedness [your sin, your injustice, your wrongdoing], And for your transgressions your mother was sent away. When I called, why was there no one to answer? Is My hand really so short that it cannot redeem [My servants]? Or have I no power to rescue? Listen carefully, with My rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers into a desert; Their fish stink because there is no water And die of thirst. And make sackcloth [of mourning] their clothing.” That I may know how to sustain the weary with a word. He awakens Me morning by morning, He awakens My ear to listen as a disciple [as One who is taught]. And I have not been rebellious Nor have I turned back. And My cheeks to those who pluck out the beard; I did not hide My face from insults and spitting. Therefore, I have not been ashamed or humiliated. Therefore, I have made My face like flint, And I know that I shall not be put to shame. Who will [dare to] contend with Me? Let us stand up to each other; Who is My adversary? Let him approach Me. Who is he who condemns Me [as guilty]? Indeed, they will all wear out like a garment; The moth will eat them. Who obeys the voice of His Servant, Yet who walks in darkness and has no light? Let him trust and be confident in the name of the L ord and let him rely on his God. Who surround yourselves with torches, Walk by the light of your [self-made] fire And among the torches that you have set ablaze. But this you will have from My hand: You will lie down in [a place of] torment.
Why, when I came, was there no man [to greet Me]?
I clothe the heavens with the blackness [of storm clouds]
The Lord G od has given Me [His Servant] the tongue of disciples [as One who is taught],
The Lord G od has opened My ear,
I turned My back to those who strike Me,
For the Lord G od helps Me,
He who declares Me in the right is near;
In fact, the Lord G od helps Me;
Who is among you who fears the L ord ,
Listen carefully, all you who kindle your own fire [devising your own man-made plan of salvation],

51.verse_text: “Listen to Me, you who pursue righteousness (right standing with God), Who seek and inquire of the L ord : Look to the rock from which you were cut And to the excavation of the quarry from which you were dug. And to Sarah who gave birth to you in pain; For I called him when he was but one, Then I blessed him and made him many.” He will comfort all her ruins. And He will make her wilderness like Eden, And her desert like the garden of the L ord ; Joy and gladness will be found in her, Thanksgiving and the voice of a melody. And hear Me, O My nation; For a [divine] law will go forth from Me, And I will quickly establish My justice as a light to the peoples. And My arms will judge the peoples; The islands and coastlands will wait for Me, And they will wait with hope and confident expectation for My arm. Then look to the earth beneath; For the heavens will be torn to pieces and vanish like smoke, And the earth will wear out like a garment And its inhabitants will die in like manner. But My salvation will be forever, And My righteousness (justice) [and faithfully fulfilled promise] will not be broken. The people in whose heart is My law and instruction; Do not fear the reproach and taunting of man, Nor be distressed at their reviling. And the worm will eat them like wool. But My righteousness and justice [faithfully promised] will exist forever, And My salvation to all generations.” Awake as in the ancient days, as in the generations of long ago. Was it not You who cut Rahab (Egypt) in pieces, Who pierced the dragon [of Egypt]? The waters of the great deep, Who made the depths of the sea a pathway For the redeemed to cross over? And come with joyful shouting to Zion; Everlasting joy will be on their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy, And sorrow and sighing will flee away. Who are you that you are afraid of man who dies And of a son of man who is made [as destructible] as grass, Who stretched out the heavens And laid the foundations of the earth, That you continually tremble with fear all day long because of the rage of the oppressor, As he takes aim to destroy? And where is the rage of the oppressor? You who have drunk at the hand of the L ord the cup of His wrath, You who have drunk the cup of staggering and intoxication to the dregs [leaving only sediment]. Nor is there anyone to take her by the hand among all the sons she has reared. Who will show sympathy for you and mourn with you? The desolation and destruction [on the land and city], famine and sword [on the inhabitants]; How shall I comfort you? They lie helpless at the head of every street, Like an antelope in a net, Full [from drinking] of the wrath of the L ord , The rebuke of your God. Who are drunk, but not with wine [but overwhelmed by the wrath of God]. Who pleads the cause of His people, “Listen carefully, I have taken from your hand the cup of staggering and intoxication, The cup of My wrath; You shall never drink it again. Who have said to you, ‘Lie down so that we may walk over you.’ You have even made your back like the ground And like the street for those who walk over it.”
Look to Abraham your father
For the L ord will comfort Zion [in her captivity];
“Listen carefully to Me [says the L ord ], O My people,
My righteousness (justice) is near, My salvation has gone forth,
Lift up your eyes to the heavens,
Listen to Me, you who know righteousness (right standing with God),
For the moth will eat them like a garment,
Awake, awake, put on strength and might, O arm of the L ord ;
Was it not You who dried up the [Red] Sea,
So the redeemed of the L ord will return
“I, even I, am He who comforts you.
That you have forgotten the L ord your Maker,
The [captive] exile will soon be set free, and will not die in the dungeon, nor will his food be lacking.
For I am the L ord your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—the L ord of hosts is His name.

I have put My words in your mouth and have covered you with the shadow of My hand, to establish the [renewed] heavens and lay the foundations of the [renewed] earth, and to say to Zion (Jerusalem), ‘You are My people.’ ”
Wake yourself up! Wake yourself up! Stand up, O Jerusalem,
There is no one to guide her among all the sons she has borne,
These two tragedies have befallen you;
Your sons have fainted;
Therefore, now hear this, you who are afflicted,
So says your Lord, the L ord , who is also your God
I will put it into the hands of your tormentors,

52.verse_text: Awake, awake, Put on your strength, O Zion; Put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city; For the uncircumcised and the unclean Will no longer come into you. O captive Jerusalem; Rid yourself of the chains around your neck, O captive Daughter of Zion. Are the feet of him who brings good news, Who announces peace, Who brings good news of good [things], Who announces salvation, Who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!” Together they shout for joy; For they will see face to face The return of the L ord to Zion. You ruins of Jerusalem; For the L ord has comforted His people, He has redeemed Jerusalem. Before the eyes of all the nations [revealing Himself as the One by Whom Israel is redeemed from captivity], That all the ends of the earth may see The salvation of our God. Touch no unclean thing; Go out of the midst of her (Babylon), purify yourselves, You who carry the articles of the L ord [on your journey from there]. Nor will you go in flight [fleeing, as you did from the Egyptians]; For the L ord will go before you, And the God of Israel will be your rear guard. He will be raised and lifted up and greatly exalted. So His appearance was marred more than any man And His form [marred] more than the sons of men. Kings will shut their mouths because of Him; For what they had not been told they will see, And what they had not heard they will understand.
Shake yourself from the dust, arise,
For the L ord says this, “You were sold for nothing and you will be redeemed, but not with money.”
For the Lord G od says this, “My people went down at the first into Egypt to live there; and [many years later Sennacherib] the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

But now, what do I have here,” declares the L ord , “seeing that My people have been taken away without reason? Those who rule over them howl [with taunting and mockery of salvation],” declares the L ord , “and My name is continually blasphemed all day long.
Therefore My people shall know My Name and what it means. Therefore in that day I am the One who is speaking, ‘Here I am.’ ”
How beautiful and delightful on the mountains
Listen! Your watchmen lift up their voices,
The L ord has bared His holy arm (His infinite power)
Depart, depart, go out from there (the lands of exile),
For you will not go out in a hurry [as when you left Egypt],
Indeed, My Servant (the Messiah) will act wisely and prosper;
Just as many were astonished and appalled at you, My people,
So He will sprinkle many nations [with His blood, providing salvation],

53.verse_text: Who has believed [confidently trusted in, relied on, and adhered to] our message [of salvation]? And to whom [if not us] has the arm and infinite power of the L ord been revealed? And like a root out of dry ground; He has no stately form or majestic splendor That we would look at Him, A Man of sorrows and pain and acquainted with grief; And like One from whom men hide their faces He was despised, and we did not appreciate His worth or esteem Him. And He has carried our sorrows and pains; Yet we [ignorantly] assumed that He was stricken, Struck down by God and degraded and humiliated [by Him]. He was crushed for our wickedness [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing]; The punishment [required] for our well-being fell on Him, And by His stripes (wounds) we are healed. We have turned, each one, to his own way; But the L ord has caused the wickedness of us all [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing] To fall on Him [instead of us]. Yet He did not open His mouth [to complain or defend Himself]; Like a lamb that is led to the slaughter, And like a sheep that is silent before her shearers, So He did not open His mouth. That He was cut off from the land of the living [by His death] For the transgression of my people, to whom the stroke [of death] was due? But He was with a rich man in His death, Because He had done no violence, Nor was there any deceit in His mouth. He shall see His [spiritual] offspring, He shall prolong His days, And the will (good pleasure) of the L ord shall succeed and prosper in His hand. He shall see it and be satisfied; By His knowledge [of what He has accomplished] the Righteous One, My Servant, shall justify the many [making them righteous—upright before God, in right standing with Him], For He shall bear [the responsibility for] their sins. And He shall divide the spoils with the mighty, Because He [willingly] poured out His life to death, And was counted among the transgressors; Yet He Himself bore and took away the sin of many, And interceded [with the Father] for the transgressors.

For He [the Servant of God] grew up before Him like a tender shoot (plant), Nor [handsome] appearance that we would be attracted to Him. And as for His generation [His contemporaries], who [among them] concerned himself with the fact To crush Him, causing Him to suffer; If He would give Himself as a guilt offering [an atonement for sin],
He was despised and rejected by men,
But [in fact] He has borne our griefs,
But He was wounded for our transgressions,
All of us like sheep have gone astray,
He was oppressed and He was afflicted,
After oppression and judgment He was taken away;
His grave was assigned with the wicked,
Yet the L ord was willing
As a result of the anguish of His soul,
Therefore, I will divide and give Him a portion with the great [kings and rulers],

54.verse_text: “Shout for joy, O barren one, she who has not given birth; Break forth into joyful shouting and rejoice, she who has not gone into labor [with child]! For the [spiritual] sons of the desolate one will be more numerous Than the sons of the married woman,” says the L ord . Stretch out the curtains of your dwellings, do not spare them; Lengthen your tent ropes And make your pegs (stakes) firm [in the ground]. And your descendants will take possession of nations And will inhabit deserted cities. And do not feel humiliated or ashamed, for you will not be disgraced. For you will forget the shame of your youth, And you will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood. The L ord of hosts is His name; And your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel, Who is called the God of the whole earth. Like a wife who has been abandoned, grieved in spirit, And like a wife [married] in her youth when she is [later] rejected and scorned,” Says your God. But with great compassion and mercy I will gather you [to Myself again]. I hid My face from you for a moment, But with everlasting kindness I will have compassion on you,” Says the L ord your Redeemer. As I swore [an oath] that the waters of Noah Would not flood the earth again; In the same way I have sworn that I will not be angry with you Nor will I rebuke you. But My lovingkindness will not be removed from you, Nor will My covenant of peace be shaken,” Says the L ord who has compassion on you. Listen carefully, I will set your [precious] stones in mortar, And lay your foundations with sapphires. And your gates of [shining] beryl stones, You will be far from [even the thought of] oppression, for you will not fear, And from terror, for it will not come near you. Whoever attacks you will fall because of you. And who produces a weapon for its purpose; And I have created the destroyer to inflict ruin. And every tongue that rises against you in judgment you will condemn. This [peace, righteousness, security, and triumph over opposition] is the heritage of the servants of the L ord , And this is their vindication from Me,” says the L ord .
“Enlarge the site of your tent [to make room for more children];
For you will spread out to the right and to the left;
“Do not fear, for you will not be put to shame,
For your husband is your Maker,
For the L ord has called you,
“For a brief moment I abandoned you,
“For this is like the waters of Noah to Me,
For the mountains may be removed and the hills may shake,
“O you afflicted [city], storm-tossed, and not comforted,
And I will make your battlements of rubies, And all your [barrier] walls of precious stones. And great will be the well-being of your sons.
And all your [spiritual] sons will be disciples [of the L ord ],
You will be firmly established in righteousness:
If anyone fiercely attacks you it will not be from Me.
Listen carefully, I have created the smith who blows on the fire of coals
No weapon that is formed against you will succeed;

55.verse_text: “Everyone who thirsts, come to the waters; And you who have no money come, buy grain and eat. Come, buy wine and milk Without money and without cost [simply accept it as a gift from God]. And your earnings for what does not satisfy? Listen carefully to Me, and eat what is good, Hear, so that your soul may live; And I will make an everlasting covenant with you, According to the faithful mercies [promised and] shown to David. A leader and commander to the peoples. And a nation that does not know you will run to you, Because of the L ord your God, even the Holy One of Israel; For He has glorified you.” Call on Him [for salvation] while He is near. And the unrighteous man his thoughts; And let him return to the L ord , And He will have compassion (mercy) on him, And to our God, For He will abundantly pardon. Nor are your ways My ways,” declares the L ord . So are My ways higher than your ways And My thoughts higher than your thoughts. And do not return there without watering the earth, Making it bear and sprout, And providing seed to the sower and bread to the eater, It will not return to Me void (useless, without result), Without accomplishing what I desire, And without succeeding in the matter for which I sent it. And be led forth [by the L ord Himself] with peace; The mountains and the hills will break forth into shouts of joy before you, And all the trees of the field will clap their hands. And instead of the nettle the myrtle tree will grow; And it will be a memorial to the L ord , For an everlasting sign [of His mercy] which will not be cut off.”
Why do you spend money for that which is not bread, And let your soul delight in abundance.
Incline your ear [to listen] and come to Me;
Listen carefully, I have appointed him [David, representing the Messiah] to be a witness to the nations [regarding salvation],
In fact, you [Israel] will call a nation that you do not know,
Seek the L ord while He may be found;
Let the wicked leave (behind) his way
“For My thoughts are not your thoughts,
“For as the heavens are higher than the earth,
For as the rain and snow come down from heaven,
So will My word be which goes out of My mouth;
For you will go out [from exile] with joy
Instead of the thorn bush the cypress tree will grow,

56.verse_text: This is what the L ord says, “Maintain justice and do righteousness, For My salvation is soon to come, And My righteousness and justice is soon to be revealed. And the son of man who takes hold of it, Who keeps the Sabbath without profaning it, And keeps his hand from doing any evil.” “The L ord will most certainly separate me from His people.” And do not let the eunuch say, “Look, I am a dry tree.” “To the eunuchs who keep My Sabbaths And choose what pleases Me, And hold firmly to My covenant, And a name better than that of sons and daughters; I will give them an everlasting name which will not be cut off. To minister to Him, and to love the name of the L ord , To be His servants, everyone who keeps the Sabbath without profaning it And holds fast to My covenant [by conscientious obedience]; And make them joyful in My house of prayer. For My house will be called a house of prayer for all the peoples.” “I will gather yet others to them (Israel), to those [already] gathered.” All you beasts (hostile nations) in the forest, Come to eat. They are all without knowledge. They are all mute dogs, they cannot bark; Panting, lying down, they love to slumber. They are shepherds who have no understanding; They have all turned to their own way, Each one to his unlawful gain, without exception. And tomorrow will be like today, very great indeed.”
Blessed (happy, fortunate) is the man who does this,
Do not let the foreigner who has joined himself to the L ord say,
This is what the L ord says,
To them I will give in My house and within My walls a memorial,
“Also the foreigners who join themselves to the L ord ,
All these I will bring to My holy mountain Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be accepted on My altar;
The Lord G od , who gathers the dispersed of Israel, declares:
All you beasts of the field,
And the dogs are greedy; they never have enough.
“Come,” [they say,] “let us get wine, and let us fill ourselves with strong drink;

57.verse_text: The righteous man perishes [at the hand of evil], and no one takes it to heart; Faithful and devout men are taken away, while no one understands That the righteous person is taken away [to be spared] from disaster and evil. They rest in their beds (graves), Each one who walked uprightly [following God’s will, living with integrity]. Offspring of an adulterer and a prostitute. Against whom do you open wide your mouth And stick out your tongue? Are you not children of rebellion (sin), Offspring of deceit, Under every green and leafy tree, Who slaughter the children [in sacrifice] in the ravines Under the clefts of the rocks? Is your portion, they (the idols) are your lot; Even to them you have poured out a drink offering, You have offered a grain offering. Should I be quiet concerning these things [leaving them unpunished—bearing them with patience]? You have [openly and shamelessly] made your [idolatrous and adulterous] bed; Even there you went up to offer sacrifice [to idols, in spiritual unfaithfulness to Me]. You have set up your [pagan] symbol; Indeed, far removed from Me, you have uncovered yourself, And have gone up and made your bed wide. And you have made a [new] agreement for yourself with the adulterers, You have loved their bed, You have sent your messengers a great distance And made them go down to Sheol (the realm of the dead). Yet you did not say, ‘It is no use.’ Therefore you did not grow weak. Was I not silent even for a long time And [as a result] you do not fear Me? But they will not benefit you. But the wind will carry them all away, A [mere] breath will take them. But he who takes refuge in Me will possess the land [Judea] And will inherit My holy mountain.” “Build up, build up, clear the way. Remove the stumbling block out of the way [of the spiritual return] of My people.” He who inhabits eternity, Whose name is Holy says this, “I dwell on the high and holy place, In order to revive the spirit of the humble And to revive the heart of the contrite [overcome with sorrow for sin]. Nor will I always be angry; For [if I did stay angry] the spirit [of man] would grow weak before Me, And the breath of those whom I have created. I hid My face and was angry, And he went on turning away and backsliding, in the way of his [own willful] heart. I will lead him [also] and will restore comfort to him and to those who mourn for him, Peace, peace, to him who is far away [both Jew and Gentile] and to him who is near!” Says the L ord ; “And I will heal him [making his lips blossom anew with thankful praise].” For it cannot be quiet, And its waters toss up mire and mud.
He enters into peace [through death];
“But come here, you sons of a sorceress [raised in deception and superstition],
Of whom do you make fun?
Who inflame yourselves [with lust in pagan rites] among the oaks (terebinth trees),
Among the smooth stones of the ravine
Upon a high and lofty mountain

Behind the door and the doorpost You have looked [with passion] on their manhood. And increased your perfumes; You found renewed strength, That you lied and did not remember Me, Nor give Me a thought? But also with the contrite and humble in spirit
You have gone to the king [of a pagan land] with oil
You were wearied by the length of your road,
“About whom were you worried and fearful
I will declare your [hypocritical] righteousness and your deeds,
When you cry out [for help], let your [ridiculous] collection of idols save you.
And it will be said,
For the high and exalted One
For I will not contend forever,
Because of the wickedness of his unjust gain I was angry and struck him;
I have seen his [willful] ways, but I will heal him;
As I create the praise of his lips,
But the wicked are like the tossing sea,
“There is no peace,” says my God, “for the wicked.”

58.verse_text: “Cry aloud, do not hold back; Lift up your voice like a trumpet, And declare to My people their transgression And to the house of Jacob their sins. As [if they were in reality] a nation that has done righteousness And has not abandoned (turned away from) the ordinance of their God. They ask of Me righteous judgments, They delight in the nearness of God. Why have we humbled ourselves and You do not notice?’ Hear this [O Israel], on the day of your fast [when you should be grieving for your sins] you find something you desire [to do], And you force your hired servants to work [instead of stopping all work, as the law teaches]. You do not fast as you do today to make your voice heard on high. Is it only to bow down his head like a reed And to make sackcloth and ashes as a bed [pretending to have a repentant heart]? Do you call this a fast and a day pleasing to the L ord ? To undo the bonds of wickedness, To tear to pieces the ropes of the yoke, To let the oppressed go free And break apart every [enslaving] yoke? And bring the homeless poor into the house; When you see the naked, that you cover him, And not to hide yourself from [the needs of] your own flesh and blood? And your healing (restoration, new life) will quickly spring forth; Your righteousness will go before you [leading you to peace and prosperity], The glory of the L ord will be your rear guard. You will cry for help, and He will say, ‘Here I am.’ If you take away from your midst the yoke [of oppression], The finger pointed in scorn [toward the oppressed or the godly], and [every form of] wicked (sinful, unjust) speech, Then your light will rise in darkness And your gloom will become like midday. And satisfy your soul in scorched and dry places, And give strength to your bones; And you will be like a watered garden, And like a spring of water whose waters do not fail. You will raise up and restore the age-old foundations [of buildings that have been laid waste]; You will be called Repairer of the Breach, From doing your own pleasure on My holy day, And call the Sabbath a [spiritual] delight, and the holy day of the L ord honorable, And honor it, not going your own way Or speaking your own [idle] words, And I will make you ride on the high places of the earth, And I will feed you with the [promised] heritage of Jacob your father; For the mouth of the L ord has spoken.”
Yet they seek Me day by day and delight [superficially] to know My ways,
‘Why have we fasted,’ they say, ‘and You do not see it?
The facts are that you fast only for strife and brawling and to strike with the fist of wickedness.
Is a fast such as this what I have chosen, a day for a man to humble himself [with sorrow in his soul]?
[Rather] is this not the fast which I choose,
Is it not to divide your bread with the hungry
Then your light will break out like the dawn,
Then you will call, and the L ord will answer;
And if you offer yourself to [assist] the hungry And satisfy the need of the afflicted, Restorer of Streets with Dwellings. Or engaging in your own pleasure
And the L ord will continually guide you,
And your people will rebuild the ancient ruins;
“If you turn back your foot from [ unnecessary travel on] the Sabbath,
Then you will take pleasure in the L ord ,

59.verse_text: Behold, the L ord ’ s hand is not so short That it cannot save, That it cannot hear. And your sins have hidden His face from you so that He does not hear. And your fingers with wickedness [with sin, with injustice, with wrongdoing]; Your lips have spoken lies, Your tongue mutters wickedness. They trust in empty arguments and speak lies; They conceive trouble and bring forth injustice. He who eats of their eggs dies, And from an egg which is crushed a viper breaks out. Nor will they cover themselves with what they make; Their works are works of wickedness [of sin, of injustice, of wrongdoing], And the act of violence is in their hands. And they rush to shed innocent blood. Their thoughts are thoughts of wickedness [of sin, of injustice, of wrongdoing]; Devastation and destruction are in their highways. And there is no justice in their tracks. They have made them into crooked paths; Whoever walks on them does not know peace. And righteousness does not overtake us. We [expectantly] hope for light, but only see darkness; We hope for gleam of light, but we walk in darkness and gloom. We grope like those who have no eyes. We stumble at midday as in the twilight; Among those who are healthy we are like dead men. And coo sadly like doves; We hope for justice, but there is none, For salvation, but it is far from us. And our sins testify against us; For our transgressions are with us, And we know and recognize our wickedness [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing]: Turning away from [following] our God, Speaking oppression and revolt, Conceiving and muttering from the heart lying words. And righteous behavior stands far away; For truth has fallen in the city square, And he who turns away from evil makes himself a prey. N ow the L ord saw it, And was amazed that there was no one to intercede [on behalf of truth and right]; Therefore His own arm brought salvation to Him, And His own righteousness sustained Him. And salvation like a helmet on His head; He put on garments of vengeance for clothing And covered Himself with zeal [and great love for His people] as a cloak. Wrath to His adversaries, retribution to His enemies; To the islands and coastlands He will repay. And His glory from the rising of the sun. For He will come in like a narrow, rushing stream And to those in Jacob (Israel) who turn from transgression (sin),” declares the L ord . Nor His ear so impaired And integrity cannot enter. And it displeased Him that there was no justice. Which the breath of the L ord drives [overwhelming the enemy].
But your wickedness has separated you from your God,
For your hands are defiled with blood
No one sues righteously [but for the sake of doing injury to others—to take some undue advantage], and no one pleads [his case] in truth; [but rather]
They hatch vipers’ eggs and weave the spider’s webs;
Their webs will not serve as clothing,
Their feet run to evil,
They do not know the way of peace,
Therefore justice is far from us,
We grope for a wall like the blind,
We all groan and growl like bears,
For our transgressions are multiplied before You [O L ord ],
Rebelling against and denying the L ord ,
Justice is pushed back,
Yes, truth is missing;
He saw that there was no man,
For He [the L ord ] put on righteousness like a coat of armor,
As their deeds deserve, so He will repay:
So they will fear the name of the L ord from the west
“A Redeemer (Messiah) will come to Zion,

“As for Me, this is My covenant with them,” says the L ord : “My Spirit which is upon you [writing the law of God on the heart], and My words which I have put in your mouth shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouths of your [true, spiritual] children, nor from the mouth of your children’s children,” says the L ord , “from now and forever.”

60.verse_text: “Arise [from spiritual depression to a new life], shine [be radiant with the glory and brilliance of the L ord ]; for your light has come, And the glory and brilliance of the L ord has risen upon you. And deep darkness will cover the peoples; But the L ord will rise upon you [Jerusalem] And His glory and brilliance will be seen on you. And kings to the brightness of your rising. They all gather together, they come to you. Your sons will come from far away, And your daughters will be looked after at their side. And your heart will tremble [with joy] and rejoice The wealth of the nations will come to you. The young camels of Midian and Ephah; All those from Sheba [who once came to trade] will come Bringing gold and frankincense And proclaiming the praises of the L ord . The rams of Nebaioth will serve you; They will go up with acceptance [as sacrifices] on My altar, And I will glorify the house of My honor and splendor. And like doves to their windows? And the ships of Tarshish will come first, To bring your sons from far away, Their silver and gold with them, For the name of the L ord your God, For the Holy One of Israel because He has glorified you. And their kings will serve you; For in My [righteous] wrath I struck you, But in My favor and grace I have had compassion on you. They shall not be shut day or night, So that people may bring to you the wealth of the nations— With their kings led in procession. And the nations [that refuse to serve] shall be utterly ruined. To beautify the place of My sanctuary; And I will honor and make the place of My feet glorious. And all those who despised you and treated you disrespectfully will bow down at the soles of your feet, And they will call you the City of the L ord , The Zion of the Holy One of Israel. With no one passing through, I will make you an object of pride forever, A joy from generation to generation. And suck the breast (abundance) of kings; Then you will recognize and know that I, the L ord , am your Savior And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob. And instead of iron I will bring silver, And instead of wood, bronze, And instead of stones, iron. And [instead of the tyranny of the present] I will appoint peace as your officers, And righteousness your rulers. Nor devastation or destruction within your borders; But you will call your walls Salvation, and your gates Praise [to God]. Nor shall the bright glow of the moon give light to you, But the L ord will be an everlasting light for you; And your God will be your glory and splendor. Nor will your moon wane; For the L ord will be your everlasting light, And the days of your mourning will be over. They will possess the land forever, The branch of My planting, The work of My hands, That I may be glorified. And the least one a mighty nation. I, the L ord , will quicken it in its [appointed] time.”
For in fact, darkness will cover the earth
Nations will come to your light,
“Lift up your eyes around you and see;
Then you will see and be radiant, Because the abundant wealth of the seas will be brought to you, The cypress, the juniper, and the cedar together,
A multitude of camels [from the eastern trading tribes] will cover you [Jerusalem],
All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered to you [as the eastern pastoral tribes join the trading tribes],
Who are these who fly like a cloud
The islands and coastlands will confidently wait for Me;
“Foreigners will build up your walls,
Your gates will be open continually;
For the nation or the kingdom which will not serve you [Jerusalem] shall perish,
The glory of Lebanon will come to you,
The sons of those who oppressed you will come bowing down to you [in submission],
“Whereas you [Jerusalem] have been abandoned and hated
You will suck the milk of the [Gentile] nations
Instead of bronze I will bring gold,
Violence will not be heard again in your land,
The sun will no longer be your light by day,
Your sun will no longer set,
Then all your people will be [uncompromisingly and consistently] righteous;
The smallest one will become a thousand (a clan),

61.verse_text: The Spirit of the Lord G od is upon me, Because the L ord has anointed and commissioned me To bring good news to the humble and afflicted; He has sent me to bind up [the wounds of] the brokenhearted, To proclaim release [from confinement and condemnation] to the [physical and spiritual] captives And freedom to prisoners, To comfort all who mourn, The oil of joy instead of mourning, The garment [expressive] of praise instead of a disheartened spirit. So they will be called the trees of righteousness [strong and magnificent, distinguished for integrity, justice, and right standing with God], The planting of the L ord , that He may be glorified. They will raise up and restore the former desolations; And they will renew the ruined cities, The desolations (deserted settlements) of many generations. And foreigners will be your farmers and your vinedressers. People will speak of you as the ministers of our God. You will eat the wealth of nations, And you will boast of their riches. And instead of humiliation your people will shout for joy over their portion. Therefore in their land they will possess double [what they had forfeited]; Everlasting joy will be theirs. And I will faithfully reward them, And make an everlasting covenant with them. And their descendants among the peoples. All who see them [in their prosperity] will recognize and acknowledge them That they are the people whom the L ord has blessed. My soul will exult in my God; For He has clothed me with garments of salvation, He has covered me with a robe of righteousness, And as a bride adorns herself with her jewels. And as a garden causes what is sown in it to spring up, So the Lord G od will [most certainly] cause righteousness and justice and praise To spring up before all the nations [through the power of His word].

To proclaim the favorable year of the L ord , And the day of vengeance and retribution of our God, To give them a turban instead of dust [on their heads, a sign of mourning], I hate robbery with a burnt offering. As a bridegroom puts on a turban,
To grant to those who mourn in Zion the following:
Then they will rebuild the ancient ruins,
Strangers will stand and feed your flocks,
But you shall be called the priests of the L ord ;
Instead of your [former] shame you will have a double portion;
For I, the L ord , love justice;
Then their offspring will be known among the nations,
I will rejoice greatly in the L ord ,
For as the earth brings forth its sprouts,

62.verse_text: For Zion’s sake I (Isaiah) will not be silent, And for Jerusalem’s sake I will not keep quiet, Until her righteousness and vindication go forth as brightness, And her salvation goes forth like a burning torch. And all kings [will see] your glory; And you will be called by a new name Which the mouth of the L ord will designate. Nor will it any longer be said of your land, “Shemamah (Desolate)”; But you will be called, “Hephzibah (My Delight is in Her),” For the L ord delights in you, And to Him your land will be married [owned and protected by the L ord ]. And as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, So your God will rejoice over you. Who will never keep silent day or night; You who profess the L ord , take no rest for yourselves, And makes her a praise on the earth. “I will never again give your grain as food for your enemies, Nor will [the invading] foreigners drink your new wine for which you have labored.” And they who have gathered it will drink it [at the feasts celebrated] in the courtyards of My sanctuary. Clear the way for the people; Build up, build up the highway, Remove the stones, lift up a banner over the peoples. Say to the Daughter of Zion, “Look now, your salvation is coming [in the L ord ]; Indeed, His reward is with Him, and His restitution accompanies Him.” The Redeemed of the L ord ”; And you will be called “Sought Out, A City Not Deserted.”
The nations will see your righteousness and vindication [by God],

You will also be [considered] a crown of glory and splendor in the hand of the L ord , And a royal diadem [exceedingly beautiful] in the hand of your God. And your land, “ Married”; So your sons will marry you;
It will no longer be said of you [Judah], “Azubah (Abandoned),”
For as a young man marries a virgin [O Jerusalem],
On your walls, O Jerusalem, I have appointed and stationed watchmen (prophets),
And give Him no rest [from your prayers] until He establishes Jerusalem
The L ord has sworn [an oath] by His right hand and by His mighty arm,
But they who have harvested it will eat it and praise the L ord ,
Go through, go through the gates,
Listen carefully, the L ord has proclaimed to the end of the earth,
And they will call them “The Holy People,

63.verse_text: Who is this who comes from Edom, With crimson-stained garments from Bozrah [in Edom], This One (the Messiah) who is majestic in His apparel, Marching in the greatness of His might? “It is I, [the One] who speaks in righteousness [proclaiming vindication], mighty to save.” And Your garments like the one who treads in the wine press? And of the peoples there was no one with Me. I also trod them in My anger And trampled them in My wrath; And their lifeblood is sprinkled on My garments, And I stained all My clothes. And My year of redemption [of those who put their trust in Me—the year of My redeemed] has come. And I was amazed and appalled that there was no one to uphold [truth and right]. So My own arm brought salvation to Me, And My wrath sustained Me. And made them drunk with [the cup of] My wrath, And I spilled their lifeblood on the earth.” According to all that the L ord has done for us, And His great goodness toward the house of Israel, Which He has shown them according to His compassion And according to the abundance of His lovingkindnesses. Sons who will not be faithless.” So He became their Savior [in all their distresses]. In His love and in His compassion He redeemed them; And He lifted them up and carried them all the days of old. And grieved His Holy Spirit; Therefore He changed into their enemy, And He fought against them. Where is He who brought our fathers up out of the [Red] Sea, with the shepherds of His flock [Moses and Aaron]? Where is He who put His Holy Spirit in their midst, Dividing the waters before them to make for Himself an everlasting name, Like a horse in the wilderness, [so that] they did not stumble? The Spirit of the L ord gave them rest. So You led Your people [O L ord ] To make for Yourself a beautiful and glorious name [preparing the way for the acknowledgment of Your name by all nations]. Where are Your zeal and Your mighty acts [Your miracles which you did for Your people]? The stirring of Your heart and Your compassion are restrained and withheld from me. And Israel does not acknowledge us. You, O L ord , are [still] our Father, Our Redeemer from everlasting is Your name. And harden our heart from fearing You [with reverence and awe]? Return for Your servants’ sake, the tribes of Your heritage. Our adversaries have trampled it down. Like those who were not called by Your name.
“I have trodden the wine trough alone,
For the day of vengeance [against ungodliness] was in My heart,
I looked, but there was no one to help,
I trampled the peoples in My anger
I will tell of the lovingkindnesses of the L ord , and the praiseworthy deeds of the L ord ,
For He said, “Be assured, they are My people,
In all their distress He was distressed, And the angel of His presence saved them,
Then His people remembered the days of old, of Moses [and they said],
Who caused His glorious arm and infinite power to go at the right hand of Moses,
Who led them through the depths [of the Red Sea],
Like the cattle that go down into the valley [to find better pasture and rest],
Look down from heaven and see from Your lofty dwelling place, holy and glorious.
For [most certainly] You are our Father, even though Abraham [our ancestor] does not know us
O L ord , why do You cause us to stray from Your ways
Your holy people possessed Your sanctuary for [only] a little while;
We have become like those over whom You have never ruled,

64.verse_text: Oh, that You would tear open the heavens and come down, That the mountains might quake at Your presence— To make Your name known to Your adversaries, That the nations may tremble at Your presence! You came down [at Sinai]; the mountains quaked at Your presence. Who works and acts in behalf of the one who [gladly] waits for Him. Who remembers You in Your ways. Indeed, You were angry, for we sinned; We have long continued in our sins [prolonging Your anger]. And shall we be saved [under such circumstances]? And all our deeds of righteousness are like filthy rags; We all wither and decay like a leaf, And our wickedness [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing], like the wind, takes us away [carrying us far from God’s favor, toward destruction]. Who awakens and causes himself to take hold of You; For You have hidden Your face from us And have handed us over to the [consuming and destructive] power of our wickedness [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing]. We are the clay, and You our Potter, And we all are the work of Your hand. Do not remember our wickedness [our sin, our injustice, our wrongdoing] forever. Now look, consider, for we are all Your people. Zion has become a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation. Where our fathers praised You, Has been burned by fire; And all our precious objects are in ruins. Will You keep silent and humiliate and oppress us beyond measure?
As [sure as] fire kindles the brushwood, as fire causes water to boil—
When You did awesome and amazing things which we did not expect,
For from days of old no one has heard, nor has ear perceived, Nor has the eye seen a God besides You,
You meet him who rejoices in doing that which is morally right,
For we all have become like one who is [ceremonially] unclean [like a leper],
There is no one who calls on Your name,
Yet, O L ord , You are our Father;
Do not be angry beyond measure, O L ord ,
Your holy cities have become a wilderness,
Our holy and beautiful house [the temple built by Solomon],
Considering these [tragedies], will You restrain Yourself, O L ord [and not help us]?

65.verse_text: “I let Myself be sought by those who did not ask for Me; I let Myself be found by those who did not seek Me. I said, ‘Here am I, here am I,’ To the nation [Israel] which did not call on My Name. Who walk in the way that is not good, [following] after their own thoughts and intentions, Sacrificing [to idols] in gardens and making offerings with incense on bricks [instead of at the designated altar]; Who eat swine’s flesh, These [people] are smoke in My nostrils, A fire that burns all the day. I will not keep silent, but I will repay; “Since they too have made offerings with incense on the mountains And scorned and taunted Me on the hills, “As the new wine is found in the cluster, And one says, ‘Do not destroy it, for there is a blessing and benefit in it,’ So I will do for the sake of My servants In order not to destroy all of them. And an heir of My mountains from Judah; Even My chosen ones shall inherit it, And My servants will live there. And the Valley of Achor a resting place for herds, For My people who seek Me [who long for Me and require My presence in their lives]. Who forget and ignore My holy mountain (Zion), Who set a table for Gad [the Babylonian god of fortune], And who fill a jug of mixed wine for Meni [the god of fate], And all of you will bow down to the slaughter, Because when I called, you did not answer; When I spoke, you did not listen or obey. But you did [what was] evil in My sight And chose that in which I did not delight.” “Listen carefully, My servants will eat, but you will be hungry; Indeed, My servants will drink, but you will be thirsty; Indeed, My servants will rejoice, but you will be put to shame. But you will cry out with a heavy heart, And you shall wail and howl from a broken spirit. And the Lord G od will put you to death, But He will call His servants by another name [a much greater name, just as the name Israel was greater than the name Jacob]. Will bless himself by the God of truth and faithfulness; And he who swears [an oath] on the earth Will swear by the God of truth and faithfulness; Because the former troubles are forgotten, And because they are hidden from My sight. And the former things [of life] will not be remembered or come to mind. Behold, I am creating Jerusalem to be a source of rejoicing And her people a joy. And there will no longer be heard in her The voice of weeping and the sound of crying. Or an old man who does not finish his days; For the youth who dies at the age of a hundred, And the one who does not reach the age of a hundred Will be thought of as accursed. They will plant vineyards and eat the fruit. They will not plant and another eat [the fruit]. For as the lifetime of a tree, so will be the days of My people, And My chosen [people] will fully enjoy [and long make use of] the work of their hands. Or bear children for disaster; For they are the descendants of those blessed by the L ord , And their offspring with them.
I have spread out My hands all the day long to a rebellious and stubborn people,
The people who continually provoke Me to My face,

Who sit among the graves [trying to conjure up evil spirits] and spend the night in the secret places [where spirits are thought to dwell]; And their pots hold the broth of unclean meat; For I am too holy for you [and you might defile me]!’ I will even repay it [directly] into their arms, I therefore will measure [punishment for] their former work [directly] into their arms.”
Who say, ‘Keep to yourself, do not come near me,
Indeed, it is written before Me,
Both your own wickedness and the wickedness of your fathers,” says the L ord .
This is what the L ord says,
I will bring forth descendants from Jacob,
And [the plain of] Sharon will be a place for flocks to graze,
But you who abandon (turn away from) the L ord ,
I will destine you for the sword, [says the L ord ],
Therefore, the Lord G od says this,
Indeed, My servants will shout for joy from a happy heart,
And you will leave your name behind to My chosen ones [who will use it] as a curse,
Because he who blesses himself on the earth
“Behold, I am creating new heavens and a new earth;
But be glad and rejoice forever over what I create;
I will also rejoice in Jerusalem and be glad in My people;
No longer shall there be in it an infant who lives only a few days,
They will build houses and live in them;
They will not build and another occupy;
They will not labor in vain,
It shall also come to pass that before they call, I will answer; and while they are still speaking, I will hear.

The wolf and the lamb will graze together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox [there will no longer be predator and prey]; and dust will be the serpent’s food. They will do no evil or harm in all My holy mountain (Zion),” says the L ord .

66.verse_text: This is what the L ord says, “Heaven is My throne and the earth is My footstool. Where, then, is a house that you could build for Me? And where will My resting place be? So all these things came into being [by and for Me],” declares the L ord . “But to this one I will look [graciously], To him who is humble and contrite in spirit, and who [reverently] trembles at My word and honors My commands. He who sacrifices a lamb, as one who breaks a dog’s neck; He who offers a grain offering, as one who offers swine’s blood; He who offers incense, as one who blesses an idol. Such people have chosen their own ways, And their soul delights in their repulsive acts; And will bring the things they dread upon them Because I called, but no one answered; I spoke, but they did not listen or obey. But they did evil in My sight And chose that in which I did not delight.” “Your brothers who hate you, who exclude you for My Name’s sake, Have said, ‘Let the L ord be glorified, that we may see your joy.’ But they will be put to shame. The voice of the L ord , providing retribution to His enemies. Before her labor pain came, she gave birth to a boy. Or can a nation be brought forth in a moment? As soon as Zion was in labor, she also brought forth her sons. “Or shall I who gives delivery shut the womb? ” says your God. Rejoice greatly with her, all you who mourn over her, That you may drink deeply and be delighted with her bountiful bosom.” And the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream; And you will be nursed, you will be carried on her hip and [playfully] rocked on her knees. And you will be comforted in Jerusalem.” Your bones will flourish like new grass. And the [powerful] hand of the L ord will be revealed to His servants, But His indignation will be toward His enemies. And His chariots will be like the stormy wind, To render His anger with rage, And His rebuke with flames of fire. And by His sword on all mankind, And those slain by the L ord will be many. Will come to an end together,” says the L ord . Which I make will remain and endure before Me,” declares the L ord , “So your offspring and your name will remain and endure. And from Sabbath to Sabbath, All mankind will come to bow down and worship before Me,” says the L ord . Upon the dead bodies of the [rebellious] men Who have transgressed against Me; For their worm (maggot) will not die, And their fire will not go out; And they will be an abhorrence to all mankind.”
For all these things My hand has made,
“He who kills an ox [for pagan sacrifice] is [as guilty] as one who kills a man;
So I will choose their punishments,
Hear the word of the L ord , you who tremble [with awe-filled reverence] at His word:
The sound of an uproar from the city! A voice from the temple!
“Before she (Zion) was in labor, she gave birth;
Who has heard of such a thing? Who has seen such things? Can a land be born in one day? Following after one in the center, Who eat swine’s flesh, detestable things and mice,
Shall I bring to the moment of birth and not give delivery?” says the L ord .
“Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, all you who love her;
That you may nurse and be satisfied with her comforting breasts,
For the L ord says this, “Behold, I extend peace to her (Jerusalem) like a river,
As one whom his mother comforts, so I will comfort you;
When you see this, your heart will rejoice;
For indeed, the L ord will come in fire
For the L ord will execute judgment by fire
“Those who [vainly attempt to] sanctify and cleanse themselves to go to the gardens [to sacrifice to idols],
“For I know their works and their thoughts. The time is coming to gather all nations and languages, and they will come and see My glory.

I will set up a [miraculous] sign among them, and from them I will send survivors to the nations: Tarshish, Pul (Put), Lud, Meshech, Tubal and Javan, to the distant islands and coastlands that have not heard of My fame nor seen My glory. And they will declare and proclaim My glory among the nations.

Then they shall bring all your countrymen (children of Israel) from all the nations as a grain offering to the L ord —on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules and on camels—to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the L ord , “just as the sons of Israel bring their grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the L ord .
I will also take some of them as priests and Levites,” says the L ord .
